FROGSONG is a heartfelt adventure game where it's okay to be small.

Chorus is a little frog with huge dreams of protecting the world. Being a tree frog, however, society expects them to lead a life of religious studies, instead of training to be a warrior. Their small size certainly doesn't help anyone take them seriously, either. Seeking a better life, Chorus moves to Boreala, a village where members of the Defense Guild train under the wisdom of an old veteran. They quickly learn things aren't going to be as easy as they hoped. With a powerful army and a mysterious rumour both on the rise, Chorus needs to discover how they can protect the ones they love - before it's too late.

Explore a beautiful, atmospheric land and fight monsters on your journey to find your place in the world.  

YOU CAN WISHLIST FROGSONG ON STEAM HERE!
• Friends and foes brought to life in expressive hand-drawn 2D animation!
• Talk to lots of cute and strange characters as you explore the land of Salia!
• Explore five unique areas filled with their own special monsters, villages, and bosses!
• Help your friends throughout their day to day lives!
• Upgrade your blade at the blacksmith's shop for stronger attacks!
• Follow a heartfelt story that deals with themes of hope, found family, and what it means to be important!
• Try to make the world just a little bit better!

Demo

FROGSONG has a free demo containing the first chapter of the game, including the first boss fight! It takes roughly half an hour to play.

★DOWNLOAD THE DEMO HERE★​

 

Chorus

Chorus is a young frog with a strong desire to protect the people around them. The other warriors of the village make fun of Chorus for their small size, but this just makes Chorus more determined to prove they matter too.

Elder Bufo

Elder Bufo is the kindhearted leader of Boreala and a veteran member of the Defense Guild. Unable to fight now due to his old age and amputation, he provides advice to the warriors of his village.  

Lord Lithos

Lord Lithos is the tyrannical ruler of the Taural Empire. Suffering from an unknown illness, he seeks to cure death and expand his empire at any cost - if he can't live forever, the next best thing is a legacy.

Basalt

Basalt is the captain of the Defense Guild, a spot well earned. She's a skilled warrior and has been fighting monsters for years. It's going to take something really impressive for her to take Chorus seriously.

Espo

Espo is a strange treasure hunter Chorus meets on their travels. He's traveling the land of Salia, discovering all sorts of strange artifacts from a forgotten time.

 

 

Digital Copy of Frogsong

This is a copy of Frogsong for PC, Mac, or Linux!

Instruction Manual

An illustrated guide for the game, the digital instruction manual will contain a map, bits of lore, and special descriptions of some of the enemies and bosses in the game.

Original Soundtrack

Digital copies of the music from the game, written by Jaedon Braun, delivered to you when the game releases.

Artbook

A digital artbook full of concept art and snippets about the development of Frogsong. The most detailed behind the scenes look at Frogsong you could get!

Extra Special Thanks

All backers of $5 of more get to have their names in the credits of Frogsong, but with this reward, you'll stand out! You'll be drawn as a portrait of a frog in the style of the game, appearing beside your name in the credits. 

Create a Character

You'll get to help design a character to appear somewhere in the game. We'll discuss their appearance, dialogue, and story, making sure the character fits your vision while still fitting in the world of Frogsong! Similar to the Extra Special Thanks Reward, your character and their name will appear beside your name in the credits.


 

Ah, math, don't you just love it? If you're curious where all this money is going, here's a handy graph!

Development costs cover things such as software licenses, paid plugins, and sound effects (you wouldn't BELIEVE how expensive sound effects can get). The music costs are going towards paying the composer for his hard work, and being used to purchase any new software or equipment required to produce the soundtrack. The fees cover Indiegogo's mandatory fees!

If this campaign makes more money than its original goal, some special things will happen as an extra reward!

$3500 CAD - Two Copies of Frogsong!

All backers during the original campaign (before June 23) at $10 and up will receive TWO copies of Frogsong! This can be an extra copy for a friend, or two copies of different systems, or if you really want to have two copies for yourself on the same system for some reason, I can't really stop you. 

$5000 CAD - New Land! The Swamp of Glune!

Uncover the mysterious tale of the Swamp of Glune, a hidden land to explore, complete with new monsters and a strange village full of strange townsfolk.

$7000 CAD - Another New Land! Stoneslip Island!

Survive the dangerous Stoneslip Island, a secret bug-infested island to challenge players who like combat, with many new monsters and a brand new boss!

 

Thank you so much for checking Frogsong out, and thank you even more for backing!

","FROGSONG is a heartfelt adventure game where it's okay to be small.Chorus is a little frog with huge dreams of protecting the world. Being a tree frog, however, society expects them to lead a life of religious studies, instead of training to be a warrior. Their small size certainly doesn't help anyone take them seriously, either. Seeking a better life, Chorus moves to Boreala, a village where members of the Defense Guild train under the wisdom of an old veteran. They quickly learn things aren't going to be as easy as they hoped. With a powerful army and a mysterious rumour both on the rise, Chorus needs to discover how they can protect the ones they love - before it's too late.Explore a beautiful, atmospheric land and fight monsters on your journey to find your place in the world.  YOU CAN WISHLIST FROGSONG ON STEAM HERE!
Friends and foes brought to life in expressive hand-drawn 2D animation!
Talk to lots of cute and strange characters as you explore the land of Salia!
Explore five unique areas filled with their own special monsters, villages, and bosses!
Help your friends throughout their day to day lives!
Upgrade your blade at the blacksmith's shop for stronger attacks!
Follow a heartfelt story that deals with themes of hope, found family, and what it means to be important!
Try to make the world just a little bit better!

Imperium Omni is not just another “same old RPG” game like so many others. Imperium Omni has four distinct elements that make it very different from all the other role playing games you’ve played.  We reached our initial target goal, and now we are marching toward our next goal of $50,000.  Join us on this journey to help us bring this game to life!

The game’s actual long term goal is to move all the way from the lowliest ranked player to eventually be crowned Emperor or Empress of the world, taking that honored spot from the current holder. Now, that goal takes place over 4 full length games and probably 30 years of game time.
Second, the game is not only in four full parts, but each edition is serialized, allowing game content to be constantly flowing, releasing new material on a regular basis.

Third, what allows us to bring this game’s budget down so low is that we are using a primarily Map-Based user interface rather than a full time 3D environment. This beautiful retro-gaming approach allows us to keep our costs way down, while allowing us all to remember that maps are magic. They’ve become so mundane and commonplace now that people forget how they illuminate the world. They not only take us from one place to another, but they show us what’s possible, and what we can imagine. And while much of the game relies on maps, there’s plenty of standard animated interactions, as well as plenty of full 3D segments as well.

Lastly, Imperium Omni allows the player to evolve with the content, giving players the chance to not only play their primary class, but also to play concurrent classes like Pirate, Monk, Samurai or Spy. And while doing this, the player can create living relationships with any non-player character in the game, making friends, enemies and even lovers of anyone you meet.

This is a story that begins 30 years in the past that takes a fresh Explorer just out of the Academy and brings them into the wide world with all kinds of new twists on the concept of RPGs, including becoming the ruler of the world. The full-length Novelized Walkthrough of the first game, the Captain’s Edition, is written entirely as a story to be enjoyed everyone , non-gamers and gamers alike and it is available right now.

The full novel digital download is available immediately - no need to wait for the project’s completion!  With any pledge (instructions for download can be found at the bottom of this project)!  Within the scope of the novel, gamers will see all kinds of aspects of unique game-play elements seamlessly built right into the story. So the novelized walkthrough is both the story IN the game while also being the story OF the game. This game has taken a lifetime to design, and its development journey has had a lot of twists and turns.
Imperium Omni has already received widespread press coverage with over 20 articles, including
column2: The Game-Wisdom Podcast, ""The Cross Platform Work of Imperium Omni"",  Renderosity Magazine, ""Imperium Omni set to bring a retro RPG also to mobile gamers"",  PCGamesN Magazine, ""Making it in Unreal: Imperium Omni is a new kind of novel adaptation"" &
column3: App Developer Magazine, ""Retro gaming talk with Matthew Thomas of Storytellers Entertainment”.
To Ascend the Throne

column1: “Her Imperial Majesty the Empress Illissa of the Sashire Empire, was even more stunning in person, as if the sculptors of her statues couldn’t come close to capturing her profound aura in any kind of stone or steel. Clad in armor of a golden hue, her eyes were impossible to look away from
column2: so light-brown that they seemed to shine brighter than gold in the light. The armor she wore was decorative, rather than combat-ready, revealing a subtle décolletage not suitable for battle. A crown of gold with blood-red rubies surrounded by white diamonds rested atop her head. And framed by her long, graceful yellow-blond hair, her face was so perfectly young, and yet at the same time, it was clearly ageless and timeless. She emanated power and authority, a presence of command that was palpable, literally tangible in the room.”-- From Imperium Omni: Captain’s Edition, the novel.

column1: The Empress Illissa was not born for her role, she made it. A woman who is not only the most politically powerful person in the game, but the most physically powerful one as well. She is tactically brilliant, thinking tens or hundreds of steps ahead of others. Her rule is even-handed but unrepentant and absolute. And she will never yield power without a fight, and she is absolutely certain she will always win. Because no one has ever beaten her. In terms of the story, much of the Player’s life will actually be spent in service to The Empress. She is not the enemy, she is simply a profound force to be reckoned with. And during the game the player will make many and varied allies or enemies in the long quest for the throne
column2: a Half-Orc male Chancellor, a Human female Supreme Chancellor, a pure Elven female Countess, a Human male Grandmaster of All Monks. Every type and kind of being can be a critical piece in the arduous path to the top.

column1: Content is King in the world of Role Playing, and Imperium Omni delivers multiple systems to provide that content in diverse and often unique ways. Players will find plenty of the familiar in Imperium Omni to ground them in all that they know of classic, large-scale RPGs such as deep storylines, fantasy classes, crafting and combat. But amidst that landscape of the familiar they will find not just a whole new world to explore, but new ways to explore it. In one of the game’s most exciting innovations, players will use the StoryTellers' proprietary Concurrent Class System™ to not only play their primary class, but also simultaneously play secondary alternative classes or professions such as Pirate or Monk or Samurai or Spy. Since players can explore multiple classes, this gives room to a vast array of stories-within-stories to tell, like tales of The Knights of The Concordance in The Round or The Towers of The Pharaoh or of Dead Man’s Cove and the Pirate Isles.

There are also player-created Missions and Stories, allowing real in-game players to craft missions that other players can do. And then there are the many Mysteries that the game has yet to reveal, such as

“Imperium Omni” is the Empress’ motto, and yet it is in a language “that has been dead for hundreds of thousands of years”? What is Technomancy ... objects from before the “Re-Creation” that seem to exist outside-of-time without ever decaying? How does an entire Dwarven Kingdom get sealed off forever? Who is the Eastern King who has done what no one in history has done by uniting what cannot be ruled? And where does he come from, and does he serve the nearly omnipotent enemy Raunos? Tales within tales. And while these things allow an almost infinite permutations on Content, yet another novel feature of the game provides an entirely different way to expand the player’s experience by affecting their Primary Rank (not their Primary Class Level), where Captain is the goal in the first edition of the game. Virtually every action in the game affects the Primary Rank, every purchase, every item used, every interaction with an NPC, every mission. Everything. Other innovations include player-to-non-player relationships on a whole new level, where romances, friendships and enemies can be made, built and broken with any NPC in the game. And these relationships, both good and bad, persist and evolve from one edition of the game to the next. We are excited at this chance to create something new, yet reminiscent of those great games and we want you to be a part of it as well.

Stretch Goals  - We reached our first target, now we need to hit the next goal of $50,000:  At $50,000 we expand the content, both standard and 3D, for the Pendellhaven Prelude. We add additional locations, items, map expansions and 3D interactions.  Once we hit $50,000, our second goal is $75,000 to expand the next sections of the serialization, one by one bringing us outside Pendellhaven Valley, and to be able to explore more cities, regions and countries within this vast world. In the long-term, all goals enhance Imperium Omni, bringing increased content, additional media and additional capabilities to the game.

StoryTellers Entertainment is the brainchild of author and game designer Matthew S. Thomas. Matthew Thomas wrote his first novel at the age of 12, and has written many others since as well as screenplays, poetry and cookbooks and won a finalist’s award in the Vanity Fair Screenplay Contest. But that isn’t the only way to tell a story. He’s also been an avid RPG gamer, both tabletop dice-and-paper as well as video games, going back to Zork and Bard’s Tale and up to the current crop of Elder Scrolls, Dragon Age and The Witcher. And while playing RPG’s is a passion, designing them is an even greater passion, as he was a presenting speaker at the 2012 Game Design Conference in San Francisco, game designer on two interactive-novel RPG games DUSK: A Vampire’s Tale and Phantom Government, as well as being a developer and designer on the social media game King of the World. The game Imperium Omni is his ultimate passion, the culmination of 25 years of design work now ready to be brought to life. “This is my life’s work, and now it’s time to let everyone else enjoy what I’ve dreamed of since I was a kid.”

Back in 2000, Matthew Thomas formed a company to create Imperium Omni, gathering together 20 of the top industry professionals to contractually sign on-board so he could seek alternative funding sources to traditional methods. Traditional ‘publisher’ relationships can be extremely restrictive, yielding control and design to external sources, along with giving up all rights to the game itself. Since that stands a high chance of ruining the quality and intent of the game, we went out seeking Venture Capital funding. During that quest, investor groups wanted to see us extract some of our proprietary gaming technology and have it provide the funding for the game. But since the technology itself hasn’t yet managed to deliver the required funding to pay for the development of Imperium Omni, we’re taking Imperium Omni straight to the people -- straight to The Crowdfunding Community! The Crowdfunding Community allows us to get our funding from people who love to play RPGs as much as we do, and those are the only people we have to answer to. And with The Crowdfunding Community fans as our backers, we can be open and transparent all along the way, with plenty of opportunity for feedback. And by letting everyone ‘play’ the game in advance through the novelized walkthrough, everyone can see where we are headed from day one.

We begin in Pendellhaven Valley with the prelude short-story ‘Pendellhaven’. It is a full-featured story and a full-featured game experience complete with all of the aspects of the whole game, but narrowed to a wide and expansive valley in the Eastlands of Sashire. Not a demo, but a full size game experience in a vast valley filled with hundreds of NPCs, allies, friends and enemies. Hundreds of monsters and missions. There’s plenty to do and see there, plenty of people to meet, relationships to form, Concurrent Classes to join. There are temples and ruins, caves and mines, castles and palaces, villages, cities and towns. We've already raised over $35,000, which has allowed us to to fully flesh out Pendellhaven Valley.  We need to raise an additional $15,000 to hit $50,000 and expand outside Pendellhaven and get into the 'rest of the world'.   And the farther we go beyond our target goal and into our stretch goals of $75K, $100K, $150K and more ... the deeper the reach into that world we get, the deeper into the story, the deeper into the mysteries and majesty of the game. The greater the stretch goals, the more content! And the greater the capacity for content!

Each of the Mystery Chests contain several different items of varying type, each of differing levels and powers based on which tier it is.  The chests contain random items.  Here are some of the possible items you may have in your chest!

What if you've already contributed, or you just can't contribute right now?  There's lots of other ways to help! You can get the word out and about our campaign by sharing it on your social media, and you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

There is no doubt that video games are complex software projects, however, the StoryTellers team has a combined 70+ years experience in software product development and software project management, and 20+ years of game programming experience. Our team of programmers have in excess of 20+ software patents among us. So our experience helps mitigate the risks associated with the production of a complex RPG game.

Imperium Omni's production schedule is designed to allow ample production development due to reliance on substantial pre-production design work prior to coding, and most importantly, the use of a proven, AAA-3D game engine, Unreal 4. The Map-Based elements are comparatively simple to code, and the 3D game engine itself is fully built and tested by some of the largest and most successful game companies on earth, we can rely on its set of streamlined development tools to speed up our progress in a bug-free environment. Since this game is inherently designed to be produced in specific stages, the limited scope of each stage allows us significant breathing room. And our project is free of any requirement for a third party to approve or review any of our rewards prior to release.

Imperium Omni is not just another “same old RPG” game like so many others. Imperium Omni has four distinct elements that make it very different from all the other role playing games you’ve played.  We reached our initial target goal, and now we are marching toward our next goal of $50,000.  Join us on this journey to help us bring this game to life!

Third, what allows us to bring this game’s budget down so low is that we are using a primarily Map-Based user interface rather than a full time 3D environment. This beautiful retro-gaming approach allows us to keep our costs way down, while allowing us all to remember that maps are magic. They’ve become so mundane and commonplace now that people forget how they illuminate the world. They not only take us from one place to another, but they show us what’s possible, and what we can imagine. And while much of the game relies on maps, there’s plenty of standard animated interactions, as well as plenty of full 3D segments as well.

Lastly, Imperium Omni allows the player to evolve with the content, giving players the chance to not only play their primary class, but also to play concurrent classes like Pirate, Monk, Samurai or Spy. And while doing this, the player can create living relationships with any non-player character in the game, making friends, enemies and even lovers of anyone you meet.

This is a story that begins 30 years in the past that takes a fresh Explorer just out of the Academy and brings them into the wide world with all kinds of new twists on the concept of RPGs, including becoming the ruler of the world. The full-length Novelized Walkthrough of the first game, the Captain’s Edition, is written entirely as a story to be enjoyed everyone , non-gamers and gamers alike and it is available right now.

The full novel digital download is available immediately - no need to wait for the project’s completion!  With any pledge (instructions for download can be found at the bottom of this project)!  Within the scope of the novel, gamers will see all kinds of aspects of unique game-play elements seamlessly built right into the story. So the novelized walkthrough is both the story IN the game while also being the story OF the game. This game has taken a lifetime to design, and its development journey has had a lot of twists and turns.

column2: The Game-Wisdom Podcast, ""The Cross Platform Work of Imperium Omni"",  Renderosity Magazine, ""Imperium Omni set to bring a retro RPG also to mobile gamers"",  PCGamesN Magazine, ""Making it in Unreal: Imperium Omni is a new kind of novel adaptation"" & App Developer Magazine, ""Retro gaming talk with Matthew Thomas of Storytellers Entertainment”.

What if you've already contributed, or you just can't contribute right now?  There's lots of other ways to help! You can get the word out and about our campaign by sharing it on your social media, and you can use the Indiegogo share tools!

There is no doubt that video games are complex software projects, however, the StoryTellers team has a combined 70+ years experience in software product development and software project management, and 20+ years of game programming experience. Our team of programmers have in excess of 20+ software patents among us. So our experience helps mitigate the risks associated with the production of a complex RPG game.

Imperium Omni's production schedule is designed to allow ample production development due to reliance on substantial pre-production design work prior to coding, and most importantly, the use of a proven, AAA-3D game engine, Unreal 4. The Map-Based elements are comparatively simple to code, and the 3D game engine itself is fully built and tested by some of the largest and most successful game companies on earth, we can rely on its set of streamlined development tools to speed up our progress in a bug-free environment. Since this game is inherently designed to be produced in specific stages, the limited scope of each stage allows us significant breathing room. And our project is free of any requirement for a third party to approve or review any of our rewards prior to release.",6.0,0,"2 Campaigns

0,"

Metal Tales: Overkill is an action-adventure game where Metal and Adrenaline clash to give you the ultimate 3D roguelike guitar-shooter. Fight against the looming curse affecting your Metal brothers and free them from an ancient evil.
• 50+ items: charge up with new guitars, strings, pedals, amps, books, and summons
• 15 different enemies to beat to the beat
• 4 playable characters to choose from: Are you more Metallica, Iron Maiden or Black Sabbath? Choose the character you identify with the most!
• 3 environments: Enjoy exploring 3 different environments like Metal Den, Metal Festival and Hell
• 6 levels to blast through with unstoppable energy
• Procedurally generated levels: Experience randomly generated levels to play through. No session will ever be the same
• Local CO-OP to jam it out with a friend
• Mission system to unlock abilities and upgrade stats between runs
• Original soundtrack and international Metal bands’ songs -  you are sure to find a new hidden gem!

We offer multiple reward tiers suited for even the finest of tastes! Support our game project and choose among the endless waves of headbanging rewards: from the quaint digital-only copy of the game to the deluxe physical edition fit for the most hardcore fans!

Please refer to the table below for the complete breakdown of tier rewards.
• Digital Game + name in credits + Digital Soundtrack + Digital Manual + Digital Artbook
Physical Standard Copy + name in credits as Physical Edition Backer + Digital  Soundtrack + Digital Manual + Digital Artbook
•  x2 Digital Game + Physical Collector’s Edition Copy + name in credits as Physical Collector’s Edition Backer + Digital Soundtrack + Digital Manual + Digital Artbook + Plate + Stickers

•  x2 Digital Game+ Physical Collector’s Edition Copy + name in credits as Physical Collector’s Edition Backer + Digital Soundtrack + Digital Manual + Digital Artbook  + Plate + Stickers + Metal Tales Pick + Zerouno Games' Game

The God Kuk is possessing all the guitar gods, and through them, the metalheads. Through infinite concerts, he is helping his legion of metalhead zombies wipe out every original creation of metal bands and their dedicated fans. As legions of metalheads are stripped from their passion, only one person can really grind through the challenge and come out victorious.
column3:
cropmode=none"" src=""""/>

Will you manage to defeat all the metal gods, save the world, and become the ultimate Metal God yourself?

Choose from four different characters with a variety of stats and tastes, offering countless strategies to make your way up to the very top!

Pick and choose from a mouthwatering variety of instruments and add-ons from the history of Metal: customize your game with a wide selection of the finest guitars, turn it right up with only the best amps, and summon the best tricks and tunes for the ultimate combat experience!

Get to know the crew... before you beat them to pulp. It will be vital to familiarize yourself with the  enemies to be able to fight them all and progress through the game. Metal Tales: Overkill is stacked up with enemies of all kinds and behaviours, some of which we can present here. Don't get cocky, though, this is only the beginning.

Enemies spawn in the different rooms of each level, ready to wreak havoc at all costs. It is up to you to destroy all these enemies with Metal power, reducing them to ashes and blasting your way through the game. Think you have what it takes to deal with all enemies?

The embodiment of pure Metal music legends are here, and they don't mess around with cowards who think they know it all just because they can strum an Em chord. Face and fight the deadliest and most hardcore of Metal history, or die trying. Only your skills can help you make a name for yourself. Are you ready?

Metal Tales: Overkill is the representation of the union between the concepts of rock, art and videogame—we go a step further with the game. The love we feel for videogames can only be compared to our passion for music... hence turning them into art being our duty.

Games like Binding of Isaac or Brütal Legend were the basis of what Metal Tales: Fury of the Metal Gods was back in the day, which eventually became today’s Metal Tales: Overkill, an improved version adapted for current and next-gen consoles.

Take a sneak peek of some of the artwork included in the game!

Undoubtedly, the soundtrack is core in this game. We have teamed up with Metal bands around the world to bring you the definitive tracks you can listen to and rock on to while playing the game.

-

We reached our initial goal! Now it's stretch goal time!
$3000- I'll hire sound designer M Gewehr to make some sound effects. These will really bring the game to life!

$3750- extra programming help. Being able to hire someone (possibly prototype programmer Sol Lutze or possibly someone else, depending on Sol's schedule) to do some of the programming will mean the game can get released faster!

column2: >This campaign replaces the Kickstarter I launched in September and then canceled a few days later due to their union-busting practices. If any of the videos or anything mention Kickstarter, they actually mean Indiegogo!
>Hi, I'm Megan, and I'm a composer and indie game developer. I'm making a musical tarot reading game called Divinuet, in which the unique combination of cards in your reading generates unique music.

>You might know me from my other interactive music game, inter-view, which I successfully funded on that other crowdfunding site a few years ago. Once I released it, it got a lot more downloads than I was expecting and even ended up getting featured in the itch.io recommends blog! I had only wanted to make inter-view as a way to show potential game developer clients that I knew how to make interactive music for video games. Instead, I ended up discovering a passion for making my own games.

>Right after I released inter-view, I knew I wanted to make another game, one with a more complex interactive music system. Tarot reading is something I love to do. The card art is so beautiful, and I love all the symbolism and meanings behind the cards. I'd been knocking around the idea of making some kind of tarot album for awhile. So I figured why not take that idea and make it interactive? Thus, Divinuet was born.
>(Side note: the title is a combination of the words ""divination"" and ""minuet."" Our sound  designer M Gewehr came up with it, so props to them for being ridiculously clever!)

>Divinuet will be available on both PC and Mac via Steam and itch.io. I am going to try to explain how the game works best as I can, but I would definitely recommend either downloading and playing the prototype at the link below or watching the playthrough video below.

>Divinuet has two phases: a reading phase and a generative phase. If you've ever done a tarot reading, or had someone do one for you, you'll have a basic idea of what the reading phase is like. You'll start by shuffling the cards, then the cards will be dealt, and each card will have its meaning revealed. Since music is the main focus of the game, there will be music playing throughout this. Most notably, I will be writing a little theme for each of the 78 tarot cards. Those will play when the card meanings are being displayed.
>You can listen to some of the tracks I wrote for specific cards here (all cups, because cups are often about creativity, so it feels right to include them).

>That's cool and all, but the second phase is where we get into the really fun stuff. Once you exit the reading phase and go into the generative phase, Divinuet will generate some music and art for you based on your unique combination of cards. Using magic! And/or math! The order of the cards even matters, so the music and art for a Fool, Magician, Priestess reading will be different from the music and art for a Magician, Priestess, Fool reading.

>I plan on making two game modes. One will do the reading for you. The other will let you manually choose which cards you want. With the second option, you can do a reading with physical cards and then plug in your results to see what sort of music they'd make, or you can just play around and listen to the music for specific cards that you want to hear.

>Since experiencing the game is a million times more valuable than just reading my attempts at explaining it, I've made a prototype for you! When you're playing it, just keep in mind that the full game will be a full-on experience, whereas the prototype is more of a ""hey, let me show you the basic functionality of this game"" type thing.

>You can download the prototype (for free, of course) via DropBox or itch.io. There's both a Mac and a PC version. Download the ZIP file of the version you need. The Mac version will have an app file, and the PC version will have an exe file. Feel free to email me (megan@megancarnesmusic.com) if you have any problems getting it to run!
>If you'd prefer not to download anything, here's a playthrough video of the prototype. To skip the instructions and just see gameplay, skip to 1:17 in the video.

>The majority of the budget will go towards the production of the game, including (but not limited to) programming, art, and hiring instrumentalists to play some of the music parts. If we meet our initial goal, I will add some stretch goals to hire a sound designer, writer, and maybe even more people to help out! Other costs will include marketing costs such as website costs and application fees for indie game conventions and such, taxes, Indiegogo fees, and miscellaneous costs like Steam fees.
>The rewards are listed on the right (click each one for more details on what's included), but I want to go more in depth about some of the less self-explanatory ones.
>Digital copy of the game: Divinuet will be available for PC and Mac. You can choose to get either a Steam key or an itch.io key.

>Digital copy of the OST: You'll get a Bandcamp download code for the Divinuet original soundtrack. The soundtrack won't contain all the music from the game, because that'd be a TON of music for one album. Instead, it will have a selection of music from the game, including extended editions of some of the card themes. If you want all the music from the game, the $50 tier (and above) will get you that.

>Music files: You'll get every music file used in the game and a creative commons non-commercial attribution license to use them. What does that mean? It means you're free to use them for your non-commercial projects as long as you credit me. So remix away! (If you want to use them for a commercial project, contact me and we'll work something out).

>Choose artwork color: while the generative music is playing, there's also going to be some artwork happening. The color of some of that art will be determined by the cards. You'll get to pick one of those colors, so you can choose to associate your favorite color with your favorite card or something along those lines.
>There's hardly any artwork yet, but I feel like I should have something arty here, so here's something I'm having my artist use as a reference for the generative art phase.
>Choose soundtrack track: As mentioned above, the soundtrack will have some extended versions of some of the card themes. You'll get to choose one of the themes for me to do an extended version of.

>Custom music: I'll write instrumental music in the style of your choice! Want a mighty fanfare for when you enter a room? Relaxing music to paint to? Horror music to play when your cat is stalking a bug? You got it! You'll get 30 seconds, 1 minute, or 2 minutes of music depending on which tier you choose. You'll also get a license to use your custom music in whatever way you'd like, including using it in commercial/for-profit projects. Here and here are some demos of theme songs I've written for people in the past!

>Custom musical tarot reading: I will do a custom Divinuet style musical tarot reading for you. You can either choose 3 cards you like or I'll do a 3 card reading for you, then I'll write new custom music in the style of your choice for your combination of cards. This will include both the 35-45 second music pieces for each card and a longer piece based on the combination of them (similar to the generative music section of the game). I'll send you all the songs, and if you choose to have me pick the cards, and explanation of what your reading means.
>You can also get a sticker as an add-on item when you pledge at any tier! It looks like this:
>Megan Carnes- game designer, producer, composer, additional programming
>The tarot art and many of the assets used for promo art are from the Pixel Tarot Deck asset package by Sarah Seekins.
>M Gewehr- sound designer

>If you can't back Divinuet, that's okay! If you'd like to help out in a different way, sharing the campaign (especially with people who are into tarot reading, music, and/or indie games) helps a ton. You can also follow @divinuetgame  on Twitter to stay up to date on the game's progress.

column1: ","We reached our initial goal! Now it's stretch goal time!
$3000- I'll hire sound designer M Gewehr to make some sound effects. These will really bring the game to life!

$3750- extra programming help. Being able to hire someone (possibly prototype programmer Sol Lutze or possibly someone else, depending on Sol's schedule) to do some of the programming will mean the game can get released faster!

This campaign replaces the Kickstarter I launched in September and then canceled a few days later due to their union-busting practices. If any of the videos or anything mention Kickstarter, they actually mean Indiegogo!
Hi, I'm Megan, and I'm a composer and indie game developer. I'm making a musical tarot reading game called Divinuet, in which the unique combination of cards in your reading generates unique music.

You might know me from my other interactive music game, inter-view, which I successfully funded on that other crowdfunding site a few years ago. Once I released it, it got a lot more downloads than I was expecting and even ended up getting featured in the itch.io recommends blog! I had only wanted to make inter-view as a way to show potential game developer clients that I knew how to make interactive music for video games. Instead, I ended up discovering a passion for making my own games.

Right after I released inter-view, I knew I wanted to make another game, one with a more complex interactive music system. Tarot reading is something I love to do. The card art is so beautiful, and I love all the symbolism and meanings behind the cards. I'd been knocking around the idea of making some kind of tarot album for awhile. So I figured why not take that idea and make it interactive? Thus, Divinuet was born.
(Side note: the title is a combination of the words ""divination"" and ""minuet."" Our sound  designer M Gewehr came up with it, so props to them for being ridiculously clever!)

Divinuet will be available on both PC and Mac via Steam and itch.io. I am going to try to explain how the game works best as I can, but I would definitely recommend either downloading and playing the prototype at the link below or watching the playthrough video below.

Divinuet has two phases: a reading phase and a generative phase. If you've ever done a tarot reading, or had someone do one for you, you'll have a basic idea of what the reading phase is like. You'll start by shuffling the cards, then the cards will be dealt, and each card will have its meaning revealed. Since music is the main focus of the game, there will be music playing throughout this. Most notably, I will be writing a little theme for each of the 78 tarot cards. Those will play when the card meanings are being displayed.
You can listen to some of the tracks I wrote for specific cards here (all cups, because cups are often about creativity, so it feels right to include them).

That's cool and all, but the second phase is where we get into the really fun stuff. Once you exit the reading phase and go into the generative phase, Divinuet will generate some music and art for you based on your unique combination of cards. Using magic! And/or math! The order of the cards even matters, so the music and art for a Fool, Magician, Priestess reading will be different from the music and art for a Magician, Priestess, Fool reading.

I plan on making two game modes. One will do the reading for you. The other will let you manually choose which cards you want. With the second option, you can do a reading with physical cards and then plug in your results to see what sort of music they'd make, or you can just play around and listen to the music for specific cards that you want to hear.

Since experiencing the game is a million times more valuable than just reading my attempts at explaining it, I've made a prototype for you! When you're playing it, just keep in mind that the full game will be a full-on experience, whereas the prototype is more of a ""hey, let me show you the basic functionality of this game"" type thing.

You can download the prototype (for free, of course) via DropBox or itch.io. There's both a Mac and a PC version. Download the ZIP file of the version you need. The Mac version will have an app file, and the PC version will have an exe file. Feel free to email me (megan@megancarnesmusic.com) if you have any problems getting it to run!
If you'd prefer not to download anything, here's a playthrough video of the prototype. To skip the instructions and just see gameplay, skip to 1:17 in the video.

The majority of the budget will go towards the production of the game, including (but not limited to) programming, art, and hiring instrumentalists to play some of the music parts. If we meet our initial goal, I will add some stretch goals to hire a sound designer, writer, and maybe even more people to help out! Other costs will include marketing costs such as website costs and application fees for indie game conventions and such, taxes, Indiegogo fees, and miscellaneous costs like Steam fees.
The rewards are listed on the right (click each one for more details on what's included), but I want to go more in depth about some of the less self-explanatory ones.
Digital copy of the game: Divinuet will be available for PC and Mac. You can choose to get either a Steam key or an itch.io key.

Digital copy of the OST: You'll get a Bandcamp download code for the Divinuet original soundtrack. The soundtrack won't contain all the music from the game, because that'd be a TON of music for one album. Instead, it will have a selection of music from the game, including extended editions of some of the card themes. If you want all the music from the game, the $50 tier (and above) will get you that.

Music files: You'll get every music file used in the game and a creative commons non-commercial attribution license to use them. What does that mean? It means you're free to use them for your non-commercial projects as long as you credit me. So remix away! (If you want to use them for a commercial project, contact me and we'll work something out).

Choose artwork color: while the generative music is playing, there's also going to be some artwork happening. The color of some of that art will be determined by the cards. You'll get to pick one of those colors, so you can choose to associate your favorite color with your favorite card or something along those lines.
There's hardly any artwork yet, but I feel like I should have something arty here, so here's something I'm having my artist use as a reference for the generative art phase.
Choose soundtrack track: As mentioned above, the soundtrack will have some extended versions of some of the card themes. You'll get to choose one of the themes for me to do an extended version of.

Custom music: I'll write instrumental music in the style of your choice! Want a mighty fanfare for when you enter a room? Relaxing music to paint to? Horror music to play when your cat is stalking a bug? You got it! You'll get 30 seconds, 1 minute, or 2 minutes of music depending on which tier you choose. You'll also get a license to use your custom music in whatever way you'd like, including using it in commercial/for-profit projects. Here and here are some demos of theme songs I've written for people in the past!

Custom musical tarot reading: I will do a custom Divinuet style musical tarot reading for you. You can either choose 3 cards you like or I'll do a 3 card reading for you, then I'll write new custom music in the style of your choice for your combination of cards. This will include both the 35-45 second music pieces for each card and a longer piece based on the combination of them (similar to the generative music section of the game). I'll send you all the songs, and if you choose to have me pick the cards, and explanation of what your reading means.
You can also get a sticker as an add-on item when you pledge at any tier! It looks like this:
Megan Carnes- game designer, producer, composer, additional programming
The tarot art and many of the assets used for promo art are from the Pixel Tarot Deck asset package by Sarah Seekins.

If you can't back Divinuet, that's okay! If you'd like to help out in a different way, sharing the campaign (especially with people who are into tarot reading, music, and/or indie games) helps a ton. You can also follow @divinuetgame  on Twitter to stay up to date on the game's progress.

We built GameTree to make having fun with friends as easy as possible.
column4:
>

Up for grabs in this Indiegogo are two community-assisted Plans: 

 

Find your tribe with the “Looking For Group” Plan. Backing this gives you tons of perks related to personal aesthetic options, public game session coordination improvements, player finding improvements, and more. You can otherwise unlock everything for free via gamification that proves you're reliable and non-toxic in gaming sessions, just it would take a few years. Having this plan temporarily gives you max level, accelerates your leveling, and supports the vision.

 

Find your UwU. This plan ensures that the right people are getting the right attention, and with people we mean you! Choose this plan to increase your daily new contact limit in the dating section from 1 to 5. Compared to the market leading gamer dating app, we currently support twice the proportion of women, and, to guarantee you’re finding your UwU and not just endlessly looking, offer a lifetime unlimited membership for the price of just two months on their service!

 

Leveling up proves you’re reliable and non-toxic. Earn experience points for playing with friends and by collecting badges for things like making new friends from different countries or with different personality types.
column5:
>

But if you get lost picking hot pink text on a matching hot pink background, that’s on you…
column6: >
column7:

Surprisingly one of the most highly coveted features.


                                                                ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ 

Express your unique self (or recreate your old MySpace) with total control over your ultimate gamer profile. Get extra viewers with the Discord-GameTree profile linking bot (in the works)!
column9:
>

 

If your time is more valuable to you than being cool (or if you’re forgetful, like us), you can control the automatic renewal of your gaming sessions and events with a variety of options.
column11:

Faster, easier fun when players notice -- and trust -- your hosted gaming sessions more. #legit

 

Get more reliable, less toxic players in your game sessions when they know you can bite back!
column12:
>

If you run out of matches according to your filters with a specific game tagged, you can discover players predicted by our powerful A.I. to like the game, but who don’t have it on their list. Especially useful for board games.
column13:
>

On vacation or planning a move? Search locally in different cities and countries rather than just where you are now.
column14:
>

Easily prioritize good players with a search option that shows only players of a specific level, up to your own level (having an LFG Plan counts you as maximum level). This lets you jump directly to proven players who are serious about fun!
column15:
>

Want to find players in your hometown to play My Little Pony? Set up a listener to get notified as soon as fellow Bronies reveal themselves! *Also works for other use-cases.
column16: >
column17:
>

Express those UwU feels with extra emotes in the GameTree Discord.
column19:
>

Get over analysis paralysis with this tool to enable your group to find the best choice possible. Apply a wide variety of filters with GameTree’s strongest and broadest game recommendation A.I. in the world (currently predicting ratings with 93% accuracy).

 

Grow your new - or existing - community on Discord by having it listed and searchable on GameTree. This is useful for growing gamer groups, as well as specialty groups such as Seattle StarCraft or… The Brony Barn.
column20:
>

For the romantic, benevolent, or power hungry gamer, you can gift 300 experience points per day to another player of your choice.
column22:
>

Now that the community has grown, a lot of the most popular names are filling up. Like other apps, you can reserve your name without needing a special identifier (such as YodaBaby instead of YodaBaby2020#1234). First come first serve - mark your calendar for February 1st!
column23:
>

There will be ads, but not for you.
column24:
>

Is it cake, a cow level, a free lifetime subscription for infinite games!? Only the most worthy will know. This is the only level that is unobtainable with a subscription, but maybe you can get there first with the LFG Plan leveling speed boost (see below).
column25: >
column26:
>

Earn 20% bonus experience points from game sessions so you can enjoy all of GameTree, without an LFG Plan, sooner. Without this perk, reaching max level is designed to take an average of 2-4 years.

 

A special bronze/silver/gold achievement badge for supporting GameTree.
column28:
>

 

(LFG Plan = Max Lvl)

Have a higher chance of winning free games. When we do raffles, you get chances to win equal to your level in GameTree. Maximize your chances to win with the LFG Plan.

 

To reduce spam and scams, users can only contact a number of new people per day equal to their level. Let this never be an issue for you with the LFG Plan.

 

Get the LFG Plan perks as they are completed instead of having to wait until next year. This effectively gives you the benefits longer, for free. This is particularly useful for many of the perks above like less competition for highlighted game sessions as well as extra special sauce with aesthetic status enhancements before other members get them.

 ""Mamma mia! I've never seen so many toppings in one pizza - I mean Plan!"" - Mario
column29:
>

The community has spoken, and we listened!

Soon you will be able to use GameTree as a dating app too! Find your UwU five times faster by increasing your daily dating contact limit from 1 to 5 with the UwU Plan.

Simple, but effective.

You can back for 3 months, or lifetime unlimited.  Depending on your age, take part in matching for ages 13-17, or 18+.

 

NOTE: These plans where made before the COVID-19 pandemic and other world issues that have since slowed down the process on some of these rewards, like the physical goods that need to be sent. We will let you know when we will be able to deliver certain rewards, but none of them are cancelled. They will all eventually be delivered.

For example, we are aiming for the UwU Dating Plan to come out by the end of July, so we're essentially pushing everything a month back, with physical goods being a TBD for now.
column30:
>

Certainly you got new games - tabletop or electronic - that you invested time, money, and excitement into, but then never got to play.

GameTree will fix this by making finding, and coordinating, games with friends so easy it will be like a magic button.

It will seamlessly follow your journeys of friendship and achievement in-game and across calendars and platforms to memorialize your experiences and ensure you are never lacking for enemies, allies, and adventure. Through GameTree, you will experience the best of the abundant world of gaming, on your terms.

 

Already:

column1: • We built an honest recommendation A.I. for all games with 93% accurate predicted ratings.
• We are the only source sorting reviews by how similar the reviewers’ tastes are to your own.
• We implemented a next-level player matchmaking system - accounting for personality, values, playstyle, demographics, and your preferred games, for all major platforms.
• And there is so much more to come...
We are building a legacy. Not just for us, but one to make everyone proud to be gamers. By supporting us, it’s not just our legacy anymore, it’s yours.
column4:
>

We’re just people. People with a dream of making fun with friends as good and easy as possible. If you’re a person too, band together with us by backing and sharing this project before an evil empire swoops in to feast on your fear and isolation by releasing a hyper-profitable yet ineffective monopolistic product (and some sub-par films!).

And please take a look at this guide with a variety of options, from minuscule effort level on up, for ways you can be a hero for yourself, for us, and for future gamers everywhere by supporting GameTree. There is also a community of super supporters you can connect with here.

Requiring more minerals and vespene gas to Deliver the Future,

P.S. We’re all about transparency, providing value, and responsible use of your personal data. You can see the internal GameTree development planning board here.

Remember: the more people join, the better the app works. So call upon your allies by sharing the links below and get them involved too! This is only the beginning.

 

","We built GameTree to make having fun with friends as easy as possible.Up for grabs in this Indiegogo are two community-assisted Plans:  Find your tribe with the “Looking For Group” Plan. Backing this gives you tons of perks related to personal aesthetic options, public game session coordination improvements, player finding improvements, and more. You can otherwise unlock everything for free via gamification that proves you're reliable and non-toxic in gaming sessions, just it would take a few years. Having this plan temporarily gives you max level, accelerates your leveling, and supports the vision. Find your UwU. This plan ensures that the right people are getting the right attention, and with people we mean you! Choose this plan to increase your daily new contact limit in the dating section from 1 to 5. Compared to the market leading gamer dating app, we currently support twice the proportion of women, and, to guarantee you’re finding your UwU and not just endlessly looking, offer a lifetime unlimited membership for the price of just two months on their service! Leveling up proves you’re reliable and non-toxic. Earn experience points for playing with friends and by collecting badges for things like making new friends from different countries or with different personality types. But if you get lost picking hot pink text on a matching hot pink background, that’s on you…  Surprisingly one of the most highly coveted features.                                                                ¯\_(ツ)_/¯ Express your unique self (or recreate your old MySpace) with total control over your ultimate gamer profile. Get extra viewers with the Discord-GameTree profile linking bot (in the works)!  If your time is more valuable to you than being cool (or if you’re forgetful, like us), you can control the automatic renewal of your gaming sessions and events with a variety of options.     Faster, easier fun when players notice -- and trust -- your hosted gaming sessions more. #legit Get more reliable, less toxic players in your game sessions when they know you can bite back! If you run out of matches according to your filters with a specific game tagged, you can discover players predicted by our powerful A.I. to like the game, but who don’t have it on their list. Especially useful for board games. On vacation or planning a move? Search locally in different cities and countries rather than just where you are now. Easily prioritize good players with a search option that shows only players of a specific level, up to your own level (having an LFG Plan counts you as maximum level). This lets you jump directly to proven players who are serious about fun!Want to find players in your hometown to play My Little Pony? Set up a listener to get notified as soon as fellow Bronies reveal themselves! *Also works for other use-cases. Express those UwU feels with extra emotes in the GameTree Discord. Get over analysis paralysis with this tool to enable your group to find the best choice possible. Apply a wide variety of filters with GameTree’s strongest and broadest game recommendation A.I. in the world (currently predicting ratings with 93% accuracy). Grow your new - or existing - community on Discord by having it listed and searchable on GameTree. This is useful for growing gamer groups, as well as specialty groups such as Seattle StarCraft or… The Brony Barn. For the romantic, benevolent, or power hungry gamer, you can gift 300 experience points per day to another player of your choice. Now that the community has grown, a lot of the most popular names are filling up. Like other apps, you can reserve your name without needing a special identifier (such as YodaBaby instead of YodaBaby2020#1234). First come first serve - mark your calendar for February 1st! There will be ads, but not for you.  Is it cake, a cow level, a free lifetime subscription for infinite games!? Only the most worthy will know. This is the only level that is unobtainable with a subscription, but maybe you can get there first with the LFG Plan leveling speed boost (see below).  Earn 20% bonus experience points from game sessions so you can enjoy all of GameTree, without an LFG Plan, sooner. Without this perk, reaching max level is designed to take an average of 2-4 years. A special bronze/silver/gold achievement badge for supporting GameTree.  (LFG Plan = Max Lvl)Have a higher chance of winning free games. When we do raffles, you get chances to win equal to your level in GameTree. Maximize your chances to win with the LFG Plan. To reduce spam and scams, users can only contact a number of new people per day equal to their level. Let this never be an issue for you with the LFG Plan. Get the LFG Plan perks as they are completed instead of having to wait until next year. This effectively gives you the benefits longer, for free. This is particularly useful for many of the perks above like less competition for highlighted game sessions as well as extra special sauce with aesthetic status enhancements before other members get them. ""Mamma mia! I've never seen so many toppings in one pizza - I mean Plan!"" - Mario The community has spoken, and we listened!Soon you will be able to use GameTree as a dating app too! Find your UwU five times faster by increasing your daily dating contact limit from 1 to 5 with the UwU Plan.Simple, but effective.You can back for 3 months, or lifetime unlimited.  Depending on your age, take part in matching for ages 13-17, or 18+. NOTE: These plans where made before the COVID-19 pandemic and other world issues that have since slowed down the process on some of these rewards, like the physical goods that need to be sent. The Harbinger: Awakening is a third-person, open-world, fantasy RPG that takes place on the fictional world of Vahde. Orphaned when your mother died giving birth to your sister, you have raised your younger sister, the prophesied Harbinger, along with the help of people from your home town, Alwen. When your sister is taken from your home while you complete the final trials as a warrior-in-training, you must step out of Alwen and travel across the Five Holy Nations and face against countless enemies with your ally, Bo, to find and rescue your sister.

As avid (and picky) gamers ourselves, we are hand-tailoring The Harbinger to be a ground-breaking open-world experience. The Harbinger focuses heavily on compelling narrative development paired with cutting edge graphics that immerses the player in a realistic and beautiful world. We are also working tirelessly to continue to develop our game systems, from Bo's traversal mechanics to combat, crafting, and more.

Bo's Powers. Bo's abilities (Bobilities™) are going to be some of the player's most useful tools. Bo will have shapeshifting abilities, allowing the player to traverse the world in a variety of ways, including land mounts, gliding mounts, and sea mounts. On top of traversal, Bo will have combat abilities that enhance the player's experience.

column2: >Early concepts of Bo's land mount and gliding mount forms.

column1: Enjoyable Combat. We're tired of stale combat in RPGs, so one of the first systems we're putting full effort into is combat. We want to give the player a variety of tools to use in combat paired with an evolving AI that learns how the player fights.

column2: Cooking. A staple in any open-world RPG game of similar scale, we are currently developing the crafting and cooking systems for The Harbinger. You'll be able to gather a variety of resources from across the world to use to make new gear and try new recipes.

column1: Survival Built In. As gamers ourselves, we noticed that a lot of mods for popular open-world games add survival features such as hunger and sleep requirements, sensitivity to climate, and more. We want to provide those options to the player in our base game, so we plan to have toggleable survival features available when the game launches.

Beautiful, Diverse, Realistic Open-World. Our world features five distinct nations, each with their own unique geography and biomes. Using the resources available through Epic Games, we're proud to be building a world that's beautiful and realistic in appearance.

column2: >See more early environment shots on our website.

column1: Compelling Narrative. With lore over two years in the making and writers working tirelessly to create storylines that are captivating, The Harbinger will provide players with a deep narrative without sacrificing the open-world experience.
Choices with Meaning. As the player progresses through the story, they will find that the choices they make when interacting with NPCs have a real impact on the world around them.

Quality Characters. A compelling narrative requires quality characters with it. That's why we are making sure the people you meet in the game don't feel like carbon copies of one another. Arrow in the knee, anybody?

There are many other features that are planned for the game, but we will save those for a later date, once these systems are more refined. It's our goal to create an incredible gaming experience with The Harbinger, and we hope you will come along with us on this journey! Keep reading to learn more about some of these features.

One of the core design philosophies we are implementing into our development of The Harbinger is customization. This goes beyond standard customization to extend into customizable features that affect overall gameplay. Namely, we are planning on launching the game with a variety of survival elements designed to enhance player immersion. Each of these elements will be independently toggleable - you choose which survival elements you want to play with and which ones you don't.
We plan to release on the following platforms. Please note that some platforms may require approval that we cannot guarantee.
We tentatively plan to have the game fully accessible in Spring 2025. Demo versions will be available between now and the release date.
<li>50+ hours of main quest content (7 Arcs)

This project is possible because of the resources provided by Epic Games to indie developers like ourselves. Unreal Engine 4 is allowing us to create an incredible game, which will only be enhanced by the release of Unreal Engine 5 later this year. Quixel Megascans and MetaHuman are also vital to our success, with both providing us with hyper-realistic graphics and assets. We cannot thank Epic Games enough for the tools they provide.

The world of The Harbinger has been built from the ground up to create a series of stunning environments for the player to experience. From intricate lore and worldbuilding, to a breathtaking environment built by hand, we are confident you will love the world as much as we do. Your adventure takes place in a small segment of Vahde known as the Five Holy Nations. Each of these nations has distinctly different environments and social structures, ensuring a comprehensive fantasy RPG experience.

Valbora is the dominant geopolitical power of the Five Holy Nations. It is (quite literally) at the center of trade and politics in the region. It has some of the most fertile lands of the nations, temperate forests, access to bountiful resources, and a coastline that is unrivaled. Valbora is inspired by traditional medieval European society and culture. As Erin, you will begin your journey in the northern reaches of Valbora.

Rengea is a peaceful nation west of Valbora, whom it has close ties with. Rengeans are reserved and respectful, and highly value loyal friendships. Much of the nation is covered in mountains and dense, misty forests, with its southern provinces being an icy tundra similar to much of Indevaar. Rengea is inspired by Eastern Asian cultures.

Indevaar is a frozen hell, where the people are harsh and society is brutal. The people of Indevaar are vikingesque brutes who have managed to build a strange tribal society in the frozen wasteland. For centuries the state has been fractured by internal quarrels between the various tribes, but the Inden tribe has been able to hold unitary power over the various tribes for some time now. Indevaar regularly attempts to invade Rengea, seeking to claim more fertile lands and expand their influence. Its culture is loosely based on that of Nordic cultures.

Sanuvar is known for the vast desert that spans most of the nations, and is home to harsh conditions rivaled only by Indevaar. A famine has been tormenting the people of Sanuvar for several years, pushing the nation to the brink of collapse. The elitist royal family of Sanuvar hoards what little food the nation can obtain, leading to additional struggles within the nation. Even still, the people of Sanuvar persevere in life, accepting the challenge of surviving when it ought be impossible. Sanuvarian society is based on Middle Eastern and Egyptian cultures.

Aduran is the technological marvel of the Five Holy Nations, developing geothermal powered wonders thanks to the large amounts of volcanic activity found there. Surrounded by mountains, volcanos, and the sea, and far away from any of the other nations, Aduran can easily maintain its separatist stance while developing technology far more advanced than the other nations. Even with these great marvels of human creation, the country largely remains disconnected from the world, choosing not to engage in conflicts until absolutely necessary. Adurani culture is loosely based on Roman society, most prevalent in their architecture.

column2: >A World in Turmoil, a Chilling Prophecy, and Mankind's Savior

column1: Centuries after the world was created by the gods, chaos struck. In a desperate attempt to preserve humanity, they created an eternal soul to fight for mankind - the Harbinger. Over the course of history, the Harbinger has come to the aid of all against countless foes. This is one of those times.

Nations are raising their banners, people are dying by the thousands, the world quakes in frightful anticipation. The world is in need of its hero. A prophecy points to the player's sister, Elle, as the Harbinger, but she is far too young to carry the weight of the world on her shoulders.

As Erin, the player must complete their training as a warrior to protect Elle, but when Elle is taken from their home in the ancient mountain town of Alwen, the player must travel across the Five Holy Nations with their spirit golem companion, Bo, to rescue her. Erin and Bo will face countless foes, attempt to prevent wars, resolve struggles, and stop the return of an ancient evil.

We believe quests should serve a purpose greater than ""just another thing to do."" That's why our writing team is working to design main quests and side quests that are more than just filler. Gone are the days of the generic fetch quest!

Our quests are built as chains of long-form quests that intersect and influence on another instead of the classic ""main quest,"" ""side quest,"" and ""miscellaneous quest"" setup that is too common in other RPGs. These long-form quest arcs tell naturally evolving stories that don't start and end with just that single quest.

That's why our philosophy on quest design is that every quest in The Harbinger should serve a true purpose. It should either expand the lore, the world, or the characters. In summary, each quest should make the world feel real to the player, or as real as it possibly can.

Because the game takes place across five different nations, each with unique inspirations from our own world, our goal with quest design is to create questlines that feel unique to different areas of the world. A character in the icy tundra of Indevaar will have different needs than a character in the scorching desert of Sanuvar, and our quest design is aimed at illustrating those differences, both for the main quest and side quests.

Throughout your journey, you will encounter a large variety of characters. It's our mission to ensure the characters you interact with feel like genuine human beings. This starts with the use of MetaHuman to make our NPCs and having our writers craft highly detailed lives for the NPCs to further immerse you into the world. These colorful and intriguing characters are thoughtfully handcrafted to bring greater depth to our expansive open-world RPG.

Erin. You will play as Erin, a young adult training to become a warrior in the ancient mountain town of Alwen. Erin can be either a male or female, and the player will have customizable options regarding the looks of the character.

Elle. Elle is Erin's younger sister, and is prophesied to be the legendary Harbinger reincarnate. She has an affinity for baking and is incredibly kind. Since your parents died when you were both quite young, she has taken on a motherly role in the house, and is quite mature for her age.

column2: >Elle's complexion will change based on the player's customization choices for Erin.

column1: Master Arkin. Master Arkin is one of five Master Warriors at the Warrior Sanctuary in Alwen. He is a father figure to Erin, and acts as the player's mentor throughout the Harbinger. He is strong, headfast, and confident, and is seemingly all-knowing. His wisdom and fighting skills are seemingly unsurpassed. He is keen to teach Erin all that he knows, passing down generations worth of knowledge to his favorite student.

Bo. Borem (Bo for short) is Erin's spirit golem companion and the player's most important ally. Bo will be by the player's side throughout the entire game as you travel across the Five Holy Nations, and his shapeshifting abilities will enhance the player's journey tenfold. Bo is snarky and sarcastic, and will often let the player know when he doesn't approve of something you've done. He carries a burdensome secret the player will have to work to uncover.
Even more important characters can be found on our website!
Blue Diamond Studios (BDS for short) we're indie rebels focused on making a positive impact to empower other indies within the gaming industry.

BDS was founded by Hunter in late 2020. He has had a passion for video games since he first picked up a gameboy in the late 90s, playing Pokemon Blue. Hunter found a passion for open-world games when he first picked up Skyrim in 2011, devoting an admittedly unhealthy amount of time to exploring dungeons and getting sent flying by giants. After much consideration, Hunter formed BDS to tell narrative based stories in open-world environments with other like-minded developers. He is the Creative Director of The Harbinger, overseeing the full development and ensuring that everything from mechanics to monsters adhere to the lore and vision of the game.

Ricky was one of the first people to join Hunter on his journey to creating The Harbinger. He is the outgoing ""people person"" of the bunch, and serves as both the Director of Environment and Level Design, as well as the Human Resources Director for BDS. He handcrafted the environments visible in the trailer and screenshots, and is working hard to make them as stunning as possible.

Arianna was committed to joining Hunter before he even formed BDS. She is the Narrative Director for BDS, and works closely with Hunter to oversee the development of quest design, narrative direction, and character development. She is currently seeking her degree in playwriting and screenwriting, as well as minors in literature and film &

While these four are over the whole of BDS, we aren't alone in this journey. We have an amazing dev team that we wouldn't be here without. In fact, we currently have around 20 developers working with us on the game. We all consider ourselves close friends, and we all share the same dedicated vision to proving that a game like The Harbinger can be made by a small indie studio. We all share the same vision of changing the gaming industry forever.

We believe that the gaming industry has been divided by ""AAA"" and ""Indie"" for far too long. We also believe that indie developers can create the same quality of games that AAA studios can. The tools indies have at our disposal today rival that of the greatest AAA studios, and we seek to capitalize on those tools to prove this point and provide gamers around the world with quality gaming experiences.
That's why our motto at BDS is ""Because Indies Can,"" and we stand by that statement wholeheartedly.
Currently, we have 21 people working on the game, either full time or part time depending on their circumstances. This dev team includes:

While a lot of our team members have dedicated positions, a lot of us are working in various areas to bring the project to life. We're all proud of the work we've accomplished so far, and are passionate about the work we still have left.
Our overall development is planned to take 3-4 more years, with our planned release sometime in Spring of 2025. A game like this takes time, and we want to make sure that we deliver on our promises.

$500,000 is a key step in us reaching that development goal, and it will carry us into 2022. We anticipate that the total cost of our entire development will be close to $2,000,000 overall, or just at $500,000 a year. This means we have to be incredibly frugal with our purchases, and so every cent we earn will be carefully spent to ensure we maximize its utility.

The $500,000 goal is meant to carry us through the entire prototype and vertical slice stage of development, and then further into early 2022. All of the money we raise from this campaign is directly going to the continued development of The Harbinger. We want to be as open and transparent as possible with our expenses, so here is our planned breakdown of a full $500,000 budget.

$400,000-$450,000: Developer pay. We anticipate that 80-85% of the money we raise will go directly to paying our development team and contracting additional developers to help us see the project through the early beta phase. Even if we don't meet our full goal, we expect the bulk of the money to go to paying our developers.

$50,000-$100,000: Additional business expenses. This includes things like upgrading our current repository, buying important tools and resources for the game, improving our marketing campaigns, covering necessary legal expenses (like trademark and copyright filings), and more.

We've been developing The Harbinger for just three months now, with one full-time programmer and environment artist. The rest of the development team is incredibly dedicated, devoting as much of their time to the project as they can. The funds we receive from this campaign will allow us to hire the necessary people to increase our output and further develop the game.

Even still, the campaign means more to us than just furthering the game. It means that we're doing something that has meaning and purpose to a lot of people. As a new indie studio, getting support is tough, so everything you can do helps. The support you give helps us financially and let's us know that you believe in this project as much as we do. This campaign means we aren't alone.

column2: >The Next Steps in The Harbinger's Development

column1: Following this campaign, we are going to dedicate a majority of the funds to paying our current dev team and bringing on some additional help. As mentioned previously, we are operating on a four-year timeframe for full development, with the game's release scheduled for Spring 2025. In the meantime, we have plans to regularly update everyone on the production, as well as plans to secure additional funding when it becomes necessary.
Our cumulative plan is to release a playable demo of The Harbinger this Fall. The demo will be free to play for anyone.

We also plan on releasing regular devlog content on our YouTube channel and website, as well as lore and other worldbuilding information so everyone can familiarize themselves more with the world we are building.

We're also very excited that Unreal Engine 5 is slated to release later this year. With its release, we are hopeful that development will become even more streamlined and efficient, and that we can optimize the game further so that even more people can enjoy it.

By the end of our first year, we plan to have the playable alpha completed. Upon meeting this goal, we hope to spend the next three years refining and polishing the game so it meets our personal expectations when it is released.

Following this next year, the subsequent years will be spent refining the game's alpha, beta, and final stages through a series of playtests we have planned. Many of these playtests will be available to our backers only, and we are optimistic that when they come around you will all be excited by the progress we make.
A lot of our time will also be spent working to either market the game further or secure some sort of publishing deal, as well as porting the final game to the platforms we plan to release it on.

We can't express our gratitude enough for taking the time to look over our project. We're very optimistic about where we're headed, and we hope you are too. We hope you'll stick by us through our journey to bringing The Harbinger to life. So, from the bottom of our hearts, thank you from the entire BDS development team.
- Hunter, Austin, Ricky, Arianna, and everyone else!
To keep up with The Harbinger and BDS, be sure to follow us on social media.

Note: We cannot make any guarantees about the full production of the video game. Many things change in development, including game scope and direction. For that reason, all things in this campaign are planned but subject to change. Thank you for understanding.
