And we can use all of these details on Smalland's worldApart from these, if you just want to look around, we have breathtaking graphics that we really work on it. You can watch the life of nature or the sunset of the sun with the Peaceful mode.And downsizing gives you an opportunity to enter and explore many places where people of normal size cannot do. Just in case, make sure you do not enter into the sewer when it's rainy.Strong Ecosystem:  Imagine every animal in the world trying to survive. Even you don't do anything, they will continue their life. Ants take food to their nests for preparation. Mice are hunted by cats and life goes on.In this harsh world, you have to get to the top of the food chain as a tiny human. Life goes on while you're in a tree's branch or sleeping among the grasses. The world is full of life and struggle. And you are part of this.By the way, be ready when you're done with your building. You can be visited by ants or other hungry animals.High-Detailed Weather System: In Smalland, The Weather is more than just a feature. As the weather conditions directly determine the behaviors of the animals, it makes nature incredible change. The Rain can turn the terrain into a pond. Weather conditions are important elements that you have to be really careful.After the rain, places were floodedFlood System:  When it rains for a time, low or pitch surfaces can be flooded.  If you've built your house on some of the low surfaces or you've forgotten to put the roof and it's raining, you can lose your house, your items etc. How much it will damage depends on rain type and how long it happens. So rains could be really dangerous.For now, this system is not physical because of optimization issues and we don't have enough knowledge. With the campaign, we can have a shot to make it physical.Treehouse that is blown by The WindWind System One of our earliest planned features. If the wind is strong enough, it can blow so many things away. Your items, your body, even your building.  So when you build something, you must choose the right place or make your building strong enough. If you are outdoors, trees or giant things can be a lifesaver.And don't forget, you can make the wind your friend and you can have fun with it.Building System: While we're developing the Building System, we wanted to keep it simple for players, so we separated the interface of building system from Inventory and when we opened the building menu, we let you go to building mode and that made things easy for players. Now you don't have to break the walls which you didn't like, you can just open the building menu and you can add new structures, change their locations, repair or destroy them with the simple interface.Along with all this, the Building System shows you the weak places in your building, calculate your buildings' total power or defense points, even it shows the parts of the house where cannot stop the wind. That's more than just a building system.Stealing EggsHunting: Little people also have to hunt. As you can hunt insects on the ground, you can climb huge trees to steal delicious bird eggs. But that would certainly be challenging for you. Hunting is most fun and dangerous face of the game.Train on the treeRail System: To admit, we've added this feature to have fun. If you can find a toy train, you must figure out the energy problem and build train tracks, you can use your train. Or you can just build train tracks and use mine carts. In the huge map of the game, you can quickly reach from one point to another and you can carry your things into wagons. It makes things safer, but you should still be careful. If it's a windy day and your train is moving on the tree, you can find yourself in the river.Race of RiverRiver Race: Are you bored and do you want to do something exciting? Angry River is waiting for you. You must find something that keeps you on the water's surface and you should call your friends. But we must warn you, this is a survival game and these races may cause death. you know how the danger can make things fun.Co-op: Connect with your friends through an endless adventure and challenge that will test more than your skill! Check the leaderboard to see where you rank around the world. If you don't care the leaderboard, it's not a problem. Enjoy!Creativity has been one of the most important things for us. Because there are lots of survival games and we wanted to make this one different. We had an idea about improving the gameplay of course, but it wouldn't be enough without an idea. So we shrunk you and everything has been changed. - It wouldn't easy like I said - For releasing the game, we designed a map which called ""Lake Side Cabin"" that you're mostly in wild forest. But that doesn't mean it will be the only map.Let's dream together.The first thing that came to our minds was throwing down shrunken people into an apartment or a city's center. When we imagined how much the rules of the game could change in this case, we realized that Smalland's concept offered us great opportunities. Smalland is being developed with the contribution of a lot more people than the two-man developer team. From the name of our game to the flood system, many of our features came from our brilliant community that is following our project. This proved us how important the community is and how successful we will be together.Join us and we'll make a great game with you. Share your ideas, ask your questions, discuss features that we made and we will do. Let's take a decisions together, and create a game we all love. Everything we've done so far has been with no budget. That means we had so many things to do. We will have much more time and resources to finish the features that we planned and make a product that we'd actually enjoy. We'll be able to hire people, use new technologies. We want to make this happen and we need your help. PledgesWe are two people and we want to spend our time improving the game for you. Physical pledges such as cups, t-shirts or printings could take a lot of time and cause tons of trouble, so we didn't want to offer physical pledges.What kind of pledge are we offering?What we are offering to you is the game which is spent more time on it. When we release the game during the early access period, we want to give you the best Smalland experience with the least problem. We are offering a mention in the game credits as a backer in Smalland game platform, Your help is very important for us, and we'll do our best.10 top backers will hold the top place in the backer’s section in the game credits and on the website.We prepared an FAQ section for Indiegogo campaign and Pledges.BUDGETWith the budget, we'll have an opportunity for developing the features that we promised. We'll hire people, and that will allow us to focus more on gameplay and we can finish things earlier then we planned. From new graphics technologies to better software, we'll be able to access everything we needed.It's a simple breakdown of how we will use the budget.There are also many other features we want to add to the game. We listed them for you. If you support us beyond the project's goal, we will use these additional resources to grow our studio to make our work faster and adding new features that can make the game better. We are an enthusiastic and passionate team of two people who have made small game projects for learning purposes. We are now developing Smalland and we want to introduce ourselves to you! Our system requirements based on of the Unreal Engine 4 recommended specifications. They are subject to change based on further development.
Quad-core Intel or AMD processor, 2.5 GHz or faster.
NVIDIA GeForce 470 GTX or AMD Radeon 6870 HD series card or higher.

This is our first PC game but...   We've made a few learning projects so far. But what really matters is that since 19th January 2017, we reached the features we showed on this page and the video. So we have no doubt we can finish this project.We are a team of two, but...Everything starts with two people and we made so many things together. We must grow the team now and with this campaign, we'll do this.  We didn't have a chance beforehand.We don't have any budget, but...This is the main reason to be here. There will be multiplayer?Yes, we're supporting 8-player co-op. Will there be modding support for the game?It's one of our goals. If we can reach to Mod Support Goal, we'll release the game as moddable.Which languages will be supported officially?English at first release.  Turkish, French, German, Japanese, Russian, Chinese, Spanish to be added after final release.We plan to share language files for translators, if you want to translate into your language, you can contact us. We'll put you on the list and send you the files before it will be ready.When will this game be released? Release date is planned for late 2018Will there be Linux or Mac version?Only Windows version is planned at this moment.Other platforms are to be determined in the future.Will SMALLAND be available on the consoles?We really want to get the game onto consoles. However, this is really hard for our small team and we must focus on the game itself. For now, it's not possible. We'll determine in the future.There will be Early Access or open Alpha? Early Access is planned and alpha will be closed.There will be a closed Beta for people who backed with the beta access reward.I need more details about you.For now, we didn't create Embu studios' website. But you can visit our Presskit which is in Smalland website.What engine are you using?Unreal Engine.What about Paypal? Unfortunately, Paypal is not available in Turkey. But you can use Google Wallet and it's super easy. Every pledge we prepared for Indiegogo is same for Google Wallet.playsmalland@gmail.com is our e-mail address. For more information.How can I get in contact with you for business or press purposes?You can email us.playsmalland@gmail.comIndiegogoWhen will perks be sent to us? In summer of 2018. But if the game will be ready to release in summer, we'll send your perks a month ago.What does ""Every perks before this!"" mean?We wanted to keep list simple, so we put it on the list. That means you'll receive every perks before this. But this doesn't mean you'll get items double times or more.For example, if you choose the Ant Valley's Lord perk which has ""15x Redeemable Game Key"", you will not have ""8x Redeemable Game Key"" of Egg Hunter. You will get everything except of it.Why items are mostly digital?We want to focus on the game itself, and people in here wants to play a good game. So managing physical gifts is very time consuming.Can I sell my keys?You can do everything you want with your keys.Do I have a chance to choose my sketch gift?Yes, but we didn't put all of them into our pages. But when you see our one of the sketchs, you can just ask for it! Can I get physical items in anywhere?Yes, ships are worldwide.I have a question but I didn't find it.We'd glad to answer your questions. You can send us e-mail or reach us on social media or Indiegogo.",52.0,0,"1 Campaign

0,"

 

 

Did you ever wonder what a Soulslike game would be like in a turn-based environment?
column2: >Eidolons: Netherflame is the answer to this question.
column4:
>

Anphis val Keserim. Even for a champion of the most sinister cabal in Ersidrian history, a sorcerer nigh without equal, his ambition has ever bordered on insanity.
Why else would the pre-eminent mage lord, Congregation’s field general and the right hand of the brotherhood’s grandmaster, turn and become a renegade?

But to slay a god, even a sorcerer such as he needs powerful weapons. So Anphis set out to seek Netherflame, grim legacy of the Primordial Gods.

And on this quest, the dark mage has met his end – or so it is said.
Now the many who hated and feared him speak with relish of how his shattered soul is no doubt doomed to be food for the dreaded fiends of the Nether Realm. 
But a few who knew him better silently wonder - was it all part of his plan?

Following his apparent demise as a mortal, Anphis - whether or not per his plan - finds himself in the haunted desolation of the Sleeper Realm, a place only vaguely hinted at in the histories of the sunlit world. 

His awakening from the deathly slumber will not be an easy one - for a source such as he cannot hope to elude the notice of darker, ever ravenous entities. 

From there, he embarks on a mystical and dark journey through the Nether Realm. 
Against all odds, he must carry out the grim quest he set out to do, alone.

Yet even in the haunted desolation, he is not without guidence. 
His own fractured psyche has given birth to a multitude of voices, some wise, some insane. 
And then there is another, more soothing voice for Anphis to take comfort in.


The Seer bound her life and soul to Anphis, become the one bridge that can take him back to the world of the living, albeit at grim price.  

In the end, the story of Eidolons asks a number of tenuous questions.

What is a soul? What can change it? Is it so wrong not to care about others? And what is the price one pays for it? 

You will have to find your own answers.

 

In Eidolons: Netherflame you play as Anphis and follow his rise as the last Eidolon Lord. 

In tribute to a certain tradition, the campaign is made up of 4 Acts, each set in a different location. 
Starting in the deepest recesses of the Nether Realm, the journey takes you through a vast ancient castle drifting in the dark void, and finally, back to the mist-veiled lands of Ersidria and to a place of vengeance.

Each Act contains several hand-crafted levels full of secrets and hazards plus a few larger randomized dungeons in-between.

After the introductory Act I where you test your powers, the game lets you play one of four of characters.

 

In his quest for  power, Anphis found unlikely allies - a group of former Wardens, deserters from the Order of Veil. Their pact seemed fragile, yet it held through, for the regenegade Wardens were called by the very power he sought, as was foretold by Selene. 

Together they set out to the Isle of Gods to challenge a mythic creature in whose lair lay the last pure seed of the Netherflame. 

Their daring quest proved ill-fated, and in the end only four Wardens were left standing by the sorcerer's side. Just enough to perform the ritual that Selene had planned for.

Few could fathom what happened next, but now the pale remnants of the intrepid four are chained to Anphis with a blasphemous magic, and his own soul fractured and trapped between worlds.

Over the course of your journey, you will perhaps learn what had really happened. And you will learn of the Wardens, their bleak past and failed hopes. And at the end of it, you will have a chance to save them - or make final use of their sacrifice and consign them to eternal torment.

In each mission, you have one ‘life’ on each of the four Eidolon heroes, and cycle through them as they die. If none are left, the mission is failed. 
Saves are allowed only between missions, making each a singular challenge to overcome - true to the roguelike spirit at the heart of the game. 

As an Eidolon Lord you will claim the souls of the fallen and use them as you see fit - to imbue items with magical properties, to cheat death or briefly assume your true form - a deathly shadow that withers all it touches, but cannot long withstand the weight of existence.
column5:
>Hero Creation 

The game offers an open-ended hero progression system with over 40 Skill Trees, 10 Class Trees and 21 school of magic. In Netherflame campaign, you will begin with the base of your four Eidolon heroes - a fiery barbarian, a valiant Shieldmaiden, a crafty Dwarf headhunter and a Dark Elf assassin.

After the classic part where you distribute points between yours base Attributes, you are fully the architect of your hero. 
You invest into one of multiple Mastery types available to the hero, by which you craft hero’s own Mastery Tree. Then you fill it with Skills of your choosing, though you never had quite enough XP to get all there is, so you have to choose wisely. 

Class system works in a similar way - only instead of the more generic Mastery, you must earn Class Ranks - e.g. Fighter, Assassin or Battle Mage - and fill your personalized Class Tree with special perks, such as Last Man Standing or Berserker Blood. 

Each Class has a number of tiers and is in itself a tree, so a Fighter for instance may progress along the Soldier >
column7: Paragon branch or perhaps along the Warrior &gt
column9:
Berserker, with other choices at every step.
There are 10 base classes and a total of 70 Class Ranks, each with its own lore and unique abilities and stats impact.
column11:
>.

The main idea behind combat in Eidolons is to base it solidly in reality and then make it turn-based. The result was a curious combination of HoMM5-inspired ATB system, atomic actions and real-time basis that makes intuitive sense. In action, it feels natural, and you do not have to think about it as a special ruleset.
column12:
/>

 

To succeed, you must be aware of what each enemy can do at each point in time. Can you sneak by this slow axeman while he’s still getting his bearings, or will you pay with a limb for it? Can you step out of that tree, shoot an arrow and step back without having this wizard discharge his lightning bolt at you?

These things will become intuitive quickly, so the flow of possibilities and dangers will race through your mind as you re-align your strategy with each new development. No one takes too many hits to bring down, so you will have to watch it!

You can read a more in-depth breakdown of the combat system in this devlog entry.
column14:
>...fragments of the sacred Oversoul, they are a primeval force set on a path of destruction. Their power is essential if we are to succeed in the final test. They will not part with it willingly.


 

As in Dark Souls, Boss fights have a special place in Eidolons gameplay, and are made to feel brutal and epic, test your mastery and resourcefulness.

To prevail, you will have to use all 4 of your heroes to prevail, play your hand smartly, calling on the Eidolons of your Chain and managing your Soulforce.

In boss fights, you must win 3 rounds, and in each one they will assume a form closer to their original one, becoming increasingly surreal. And what works against one form may prove futile against the other, so you have to change your tactics accordingly.
column16:
/>

 

 

 

 

 

Edalar, the eldest of the nine worlds on our plane, is a world that has had a good life. Its history is filled with visions of wonder, glory and ruinous fury. 
Now its time is almost at an end, the twelth age is drawing to a close and Edalar, like many worlds before it, must go back beneath the Veil, into the Grey, merge with the Underverse and bow to the Nether Gods’ will. 

It must, but will it? 
Edalar is now ruled by Man, and his lust for power - mundane and arcane - has never been stronger. Indeed, mankind is now at the brink of a revolution
the technological progress - denied them for many centuries by the brutality of war and ancient gods - now finally seems within grasp.

For five centuries, there has been relative peace and undisturbed progress 
Led by the wise and honorable dynasty of the long-living Eresars, the realms of Allkingdom prospered and shed the haunting ghosts of their past.
column17:
/>
All except for Ersidria. Here the hammer of war and sorcery fell the heaviest - and the land could never recover. Nor could the people, descendants of the once-proud Valherim, lords of Sea and Stone, brought low and conquered by the allied armies of the Young Kingdoms. 
The Red Priests of Ardai have denounced their gods and brought their own to replace them, fire and steel in their wake.
column18:
/>

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

Yet for all the misfortune that befell the distant realm, it never lost a certain air of grandeur. That, and the allure of freedom, the vane glory of legends from ages past, and the wanton rule of violence attracted those for whom the Allkingdom no longer had a place. 
Mercenaries, disgraced knights, fanatics, dangerous free-thinkers and over-ambitious wizards. And of course, simple criminals. 
Such is the boiling pot of chaos where the world’s fate must be decided. 
Yes, it will be here, deep within the twilit mist of whispering groves, beneath the leaden skies, enclosed by the mournful seas, on fields of battles past. It will be in Ersidria.
column20: >You can read more about the game's extensive lore in its arcane blog!

Here is the first part of it - don't worry, it does not contain too many spoilers, only the guided/tutorial part and stops when the free fight begins.

>

On top of the obvious - the game key and backer demo - we are offering a wide range of digital rewards to our backers, including art, music, special access and more! 

Most rewards can be delivered immediately, but some may take more time. Everything will be delivered before end of October 2019.
column26:
>

Contains full introduction into the story, a short (and cruel) tutorial, boss fight and a castle

floating in hell to explore. It contains following modules from Act I of the Netherflame Campaign:

column1: • Dark Ascension (atmospheric exploration, puzzles and free combat)
Delivered as a Steam key or as custom download link on request. (Note that the demo will receive updates via Steam)
column2:
>

In addition to the basic version, Extended Demo will offer you a glimpse from Act II of the Netherflame Campaign - a harrowing adventure into the depths of the fallen fortress of Nyrn.
column3:
>

Get the game as soon as it comes into Early Access this year! 

Independent* of our crowdfunding results, Eidolons will be in Early Access on Steam before the end of 2019. 

Early Access version will provide between 5 and 7 hours of play (and receive regular updates), while the full version with the entire Netherflame Campaign - 15 to 25 hours of play and considerable replayability (as you may start with any of the 4 Acts).

*The results of this campaign could speed up the full release, which right now scheduled for 2020.
column4:
>

The very first entry in the musical journey of Eidolons was made by Edwin Pickett, it is made for maximum immersion  - the seamless looping lets you listen for hours. I for one certainly do while I code away in the murky depths!

Comes with two special bonus tracks composed by Edwin Pickett. Listen now on soundcloud!
column5:
>

Dark and Epic, the score of Eidolons: Netherflame is over an hour long and will be your loyal companion on dark winter nights ahead, as it hails from frosty Finland!

You can get a taste of its deep melancholy in the bonus track ""Fractures"".

 

The legend says that it was composed in a day and a night in a sudden flare of long brooding passion. They also hint that took a while of to arrive at that epic moment however.

For myself, I can only say it was a great pleasure for me to see this musical journey unfold, to offer ideas and and share materials that I hope have largely inspired Mika in his creative process.
column7:
>

A package of 25 hero portraits very well suited for customizing your character in games like Baldur’s Gate, Neverwinter Nights or just on your favorite RPG forum.
column8:
>

A package of 15 Full HD Wallpapers with multiple resolution, color and contrast versions.

If you need custom resolution, you need only ask.
column9:
>

A special edition of our digital art collection, it is packed with art made over at least 5 years and contains work of over a dozen artists. From classic character art to maps and sketches, vague dreams and sublime visions of a future not yet arrived – it has it all!

The main part contains over a hundred monsters, two dozen heroes, various landscapes and a full arsenal of animated weaponry. In the Appendix you will find stranger things and abstract art. Many of the pieces come with personal commentary about the inspiration for and process of its creation.

Each page is print-friendly!
column10:
>

The Ersidrian peninsula is a place where ages, cultures and biomes all clash together in an arduous mayhem. It is roughly one tenth of the known surface of Edalar.

This epic map of it was drawn by Steffen Sommer based on my sketches and texts. It took almost a year to complete and the mutual creative process fueled my passion for the project and its lore. I personally think that Steffen’s passion for original works of J.R.R. Tolkien shines through every pixel of it!

On top of the original version, the item package will include multiple Full HD (and larger) versions with atmospheric lighting and weather effects, best suited for your desktop!

High DPI makes it look perfect when printed as well. So decorate that living room wall with a bit of fantasy art!
column12: >An in-game book collection of dark lore with total of at least 50 pages, it is made up of maniscripts of varying degree of completeness and sanity. Together they offer a window into the grand and crazy vision that is Eidolon Multiverse that grew over many years.
column15: >Become part of the creative process! Get the original design document, and help us create an NPC or a side-quest for the Netherflame campaign!
column17:
>

Get access to a tester branch of the game with latest builds all the way to the full release in 2020!
column18:
>

Indulge your curiousity and ask the team any single question about Eidolons!

Note that while you can ask anything, and the answer will be full and completely honest, it must of course remain strictly confidential. Some things are not meant to be known by the many, only the few...

Want the dark secret to be your own?  Then give us something you wish to be an easter egg in the game! Subject to reasonable approval.
column20: >Get access to a private Backer or Dev channel on discord and a special role to go with it! The whole Wyrmring team is there too :)
column25:

The game is largely developed as a solo project by Alexander @EiDemiurge Kamen, but over the years a number of people have contributed to making this vision come true.
column26:

If you would like to know more, this interview here sheds more light on how this came game to be - and bears witness to how much I had underestimated the effort to launch a crowdfunding campaign! All the more grateful to Marcello from @turnbasedlovers who gave me the much needed chance to speak up about the shrouded roots of the project at that time!  

And here is the more complete list of contributors:

Last but not least, I would like to express my gratitude to my brother Ilya for his insightful advice and his wife Maria for putting her manager skills to use in our nightly battle-plan sessions.

column37:
>

The project needs more full-time professional help with its art and sound design, and the current team members need to pay their bills! :)

The most relevant and immediate factor however is whether Alexander Kamen will afford to work full-time all the way through to release, or have to do freelance or get a programmer job to pull it through :)
column40:
> 

Eidolons is an innovate hybrid between roguelike and cRPG. Like all things new, there is a space for growth, but also the danger of not being quite understood - or properly executed - in the absense of a well-trodden path.

This is my main personal concern. Then there is of course always the project’s somewhat low bus-factor.

However, despite its solo-dev origins, the project is structured in a modular way to allow for easy contribution of more people, if it has the the financial means to ensure their welfare.

Eidolons project is my life, and I am determined to realize it in some form no matter what. I see see it as a chance start a change in the genre that has, from my perspective, been walking around in circles for decades now.

>

Following his apparent demise as a mortal, Anphis - whether or not per his plan - finds himself in the haunted desolation of the Sleeper Realm, a place only vaguely hinted at in the histories of the sunlit world. His awakening from the deathly slumber will not be an easy one - for a source such as he cannot hope to elude the notice of darker, ever ravenous entities. From there, he embarks on a mystical and dark journey through the Nether Realm. Against all odds, he must carry out the grim quest he set out to do, alone.Yet even in the haunted desolation, he is not without guidence. His own fractured psyche has given birth to a multitude of voices, some wise, some insane. And then there is another, more soothing voice for Anphis to take comfort in.The Seer bound her life and soul to Anphis, become the one bridge that can take him back to the world of the living, albeit at grim price.  In the end, the story of Eidolons asks a number of tenuous questions.What is a soul? What can change it? Is it so wrong not to care about others? And what is the price one pays for it? You will have to find your own answers. In Eidolons: Netherflame you play as Anphis and follow his rise as the last Eidolon Lord. In tribute to a certain tradition, the campaign is made up of 4 Acts, each set in a different location. Starting in the deepest recesses of the Nether Realm, the journey takes you through a vast ancient castle drifting in the dark void, and finally, back to the mist-veiled lands of Ersidria and to a place of vengeance.Each Act contains several hand-crafted levels full of secrets and hazards plus a few larger randomized dungeons in-between.After the introductory Act I where you test your powers, the game lets you play one of four of characters. In his quest for  power, Anphis found unlikely allies - a group of former Wardens, deserters from the Order of Veil. Their pact seemed fragile, yet it held through, for the regenegade Wardens were called by the very power he sought, as was foretold by Selene. Together they set out to the Isle of Gods to challenge a mythic creature in whose lair lay the last pure seed of the Netherflame. Their daring quest proved ill-fated, and in the end only four Wardens were left standing by the sorcerer's side. Just enough to perform the ritual that Selene had planned for.Few could fathom what happened next, but now the pale remnants of the intrepid four are chained to Anphis with a blasphemous magic, and his own soul fractured and trapped between worlds.Over the course of your journey, you will perhaps learn what had really happened. And you will learn of the Wardens, their bleak past and failed hopes. And at the end of it, you will have a chance to save them - or make final use of their sacrifice and consign them to eternal torment.In each mission, you have one ‘life’ on each of the four Eidolon heroes, and cycle through them as they die. If none are left, the mission is failed. Saves are allowed only between missions, making each a singular challenge to overcome - true to the roguelike spirit at the heart of the game. As an Eidolon Lord you will claim the souls of the fallen and use them as you see fit - to imbue items with magical properties, to cheat death or briefly assume your true form - a deathly shadow that withers all it touches, but cannot long withstand the weight of existence. Hero Creation The game offers an open-ended hero progression system with over 40 Skill Trees, 10 Class Trees and 21 school of magic. In Netherflame campaign, you will begin with the base of your four Eidolon heroes - a fiery barbarian, a valiant Shieldmaiden, a crafty Dwarf headhunter and a Dark Elf assassin.After the classic part where you distribute points between yours base Attributes, you are fully the architect of your hero. You invest into one of multiple Mastery types available to the hero, by which you craft hero’s own Mastery Tree. Then you fill it with Skills of your choosing, though you never had quite enough XP to get all there is, so you have to choose wisely. Class system works in a similar way - only instead of the more generic Mastery, you must earn Class Ranks - e.g. Fighter, Assassin or Battle Mage - and fill your personalized Class Tree with special perks, such as Last Man Standing or Berserker Blood. Each Class has a number of tiers and is in itself a tree, so a Fighter for instance may progress along the Soldier > Veteran > Paragon branch or perhaps along the Warrior > Gladiator > Berserker, with other choices at every step.There are 10 base classes and a total of 70 Class Ranks, each with its own lore and unique abilities and stats impact.   .The main idea behind combat in Eidolons is to base it solidly in reality and then make it turn-based. The result was a curious combination of HoMM5-inspired ATB system, atomic actions and real-time basis that makes intuitive sense. In action, it feels natural, and you do not have to think about it as a special ruleset.  To succeed, you must be aware of what each enemy can do at each point in time. Can you sneak by this slow axeman while he’s still getting his bearings, or will you pay with a limb for it? Can you step out of that tree, shoot an arrow and step back without having this wizard discharge his lightning bolt at you?These things will become intuitive quickly, so the flow of possibilities and dangers will race through your mind as you re-align your strategy with each new development. No one takes too many hits to bring down, so you will have to watch it!You can read a more in-depth breakdown of the combat system in this devlog entry.   ...fragments of the sacred Oversoul, they are a primeval force set on a path of destruction. Their power is essential if we are to succeed in the final test. They will not part with it willingly. As in Dark Souls, Boss fights have a special place in Eidolons gameplay, and are made to feel brutal and epic, test your mastery and resourcefulness.To prevail, you will have to use all 4 of your heroes to prevail, play your hand smartly, calling on the Eidolons of your Chain and managing your Soulforce.In boss fights, you must win 3 rounds, and in each one they will assume a form closer to their original one, becoming increasingly surreal. And what works against one form may prove futile against the other, so you have to change your tactics accordingly.             Edalar, the eldest of the nine worlds on our plane, is a world that has had a good life. Its history is filled with visions of wonder, glory and ruinous fury. Now its time is almost at an end, the twelth age is drawing to a close and Edalar, like many worlds before it, must go back beneath the Veil, into the Grey, merge with the Underverse and bow to the Nether Gods’ will. It must, but will it? Edalar is now ruled by Man, and his lust for power - mundane and arcane - has never been stronger. Indeed, mankind is now at the brink of a revolutionthe technological progress - denied them for many centuries by the brutality of war and ancient gods - now finally seems within grasp.For five centuries, there has been relative peace and undisturbed progress Led by the wise and honorable dynasty of the long-living Eresars, the realms of Allkingdom prospered and shed the haunting ghosts of their past. All except for Ersidria. Here the hammer of war and sorcery fell the heaviest - and the land could never recover. Nor could the people, descendants of the once-proud Valherim, lords of Sea and Stone, brought low and conquered by the allied armies of the Young Kingdoms. The Red Priests of Ardai have denounced their gods and brought their own to replace them, fire and steel in their wake.            Yet for all the misfortune that befell the distant realm, it never lost a certain air of grandeur. That, and the allure of freedom, the vane glory of legends from ages past, and the wanton rule of violence attracted those for whom the Allkingdom no longer had a place. Mercenaries, disgraced knights, fanatics, dangerous free-thinkers and over-ambitious wizards. And of course, simple criminals. Such is the boiling pot of chaos where the world’s fate must be decided. Yes, it will be here, deep within the twilit mist of whispering groves, beneath the leaden skies, enclosed by the mournful seas, on fields of battles past. It will be in Ersidria.  You can read more about the game's extensive lore in its arcane blog!  What people say about Eidolons? The project has only recently been made public, but already a few people have covered our latest news - the release of the Backer Demo!Here is the first part of it - don't worry, it does not contain too many spoilers, only the guided/tutorial part and stops when the free fight begins.  A few articles also already appeared in the press - https://www.onrpg.com/videos/eidolons-netherflame-beta-is-on-indiegogo-for-all-backers/https://www.geekgeneration.fr/eidolons-netherflame-la-beta-indiegogo-est-disponible/https://www.mdegaming.at/eidolons-netherflame-soulslike-trifft-auf-taktik-rpg/https://arata.lat/eidolons-netherflame-tiene-beta/  On top of the obvious - the game key and backer demo - we are offering a wide range of digital rewards to our backers, including art, music, special access and more! Most rewards can be delivered immediately, but some may take more time. Everything will be delivered before end of October 2019.Contains full introduction into the story, a short (and cruel) tutorial, boss fight and a castlefloating in hell to explore. It contains following modules from Act I of the Netherflame Campaign:

column1: Dark Ascension (atmospheric exploration, puzzles and free combat)

Delivered as a Steam key or as custom download link on request. (Note that the demo will receive updates via Steam)In addition to the basic version, Extended Demo will offer you a glimpse from Act II of the Netherflame Campaign - a harrowing adventure into the depths of the fallen fortress of Nyrn. Get the game as soon as it comes into Early Access this year! Independent* of our crowdfunding results, Eidolons will be in Early Access on Steam before the end of 2019. Early Access version will provide between 5 and 7 hours of play (and receive regular updates), while the full version with the entire Netherflame Campaign - 15 to 25 hours of play and considerable replayability (as you may start with any of the 4 Acts).*The results of this campaign could speed up the full release, which right now scheduled for 2020.The very first entry in the musical journey of Eidolons was made by Edwin Pickett, it is made for maximum immersion  - the seamless looping lets you listen for hours. I for one certainly do while I code away in the murky depths!Comes with two special bonus tracks composed by Edwin Pickett. Listen now on soundcloud! Dark and Epic, the score of Eidolons: Netherflame is over an hour long and will be your loyal companion on dark winter nights ahead, as it hails from frosty Finland!You can get a taste of its deep melancholy in the bonus track ""Fractures"". The legend says that it was composed in a day and a night in a sudden flare of long brooding passion. They also hint that took a while of to arrive at that epic moment however.For myself, I can only say it was a great pleasure for me to see this musical journey unfold, to offer ideas and and share materials that I hope have largely inspired Mika in his creative process.  A package of 25 hero portraits very well suited for customizing your character in games like Baldur’s Gate, Neverwinter Nights or just on your favorite RPG forum.A package of 15 Full HD Wallpapers with multiple resolution, color and contrast versions.If you need custom resolution, you need only ask.A special edition of our digital art collection, it is packed with art made over at least 5 years and contains work of over a dozen artists. From classic character art to maps and sketches, vague dreams and sublime visions of a future not yet arrived – it has it all!The main part contains over a hundred monsters, two dozen heroes, various landscapes and a full arsenal of animated weaponry. In the Appendix you will find stranger things and abstract art. Many of the pieces come with personal commentary about the inspiration for and process of its creation.Each page is print-friendly! The Ersidrian peninsula is a place where ages, cultures and biomes all clash together in an arduous mayhem. It is roughly one tenth of the known surface of Edalar.This epic map of it was drawn by Steffen Sommer based on my sketches and texts. It took almost a year to complete and the mutual creative process fueled my passion for the project and its lore. I personally think that Steffen’s passion for original works of J.R.R. Tolkien shines through every pixel of it!On top of the original version, the item package will include multiple Full HD (and larger) versions with atmospheric lighting and weather effects, best suited for your desktop!High DPI makes it look perfect when printed as well. So decorate that living room wall with a bit of fantasy art! An in-game book collection of dark lore with total of at least 50 pages, it is made up of maniscripts of varying degree of completeness and sanity. Together they offer a window into the grand and crazy vision that is Eidolon Multiverse that grew over many years.Become part of the creative process! Get the original design document, and help us create an NPC or a side-quest for the Netherflame campaign!  Get access to a tester branch of the game with latest builds all the way to the full release in 2020!Indulge your curiousity and ask the team any single question about Eidolons!Note that while you can ask anything, and the answer will be full and completely honest, it must of course remain strictly confidential. Some things are not meant to be known by the many, only the few...Want the dark secret to be your own?  Then give us something you wish to be an easter egg in the game! Subject to reasonable approval.Get access to a private Backer or Dev channel on discord and a special role to go with it! The whole Wyrmring team is there too :)Speaking of which...   The game is largely developed as a solo project by Alexander @EiDemiurge Kamen, but over the years a number of people have contributed to making this vision come true.  If you would like to know more, this interview here sheds more light on how this came game to be - and bears witness to how much I had underestimated the effort to launch a crowdfunding campaign! All the more grateful to Marcello from @turnbasedlovers who gave me the much needed chance to speak up about the shrouded roots of the project at that time!  And here is the more complete list of contributors: Denis Lola - technical assistanceAndrey Zarkly - character art and lineart for this campaignPavel @Broojacker - sound design and music Davide Pessach - counseling and marketingSteffen Sommer - original map and icon artEdwin Pickett - ambient and theme musicAlexander @Shadeborn - voice actingArtem @Stargrave - landscape artArtem Akmulin - music I also express my gratitde to these amazing people from Freesound.org:InspectorJKlankbeeld Farbe1001Cabled-messUagaduguAdamgryuDigifishmusicErdieAlso special thanks go to these brave and patient testers!Malik ArrumYa-Seencousity KorikabuAyechihuahua Last but not least, I would like to express my gratitude to my brother Ilya for his insightful advice and his wife Maria for putting her manager skills to use in our nightly battle-plan sessions. I couldn't have done this without you  guys :)The project needs more full-time professional help with its art and sound design, and the current team members need to pay their bills! :)The most relevant and immediate factor however is whether Alexander Kamen will afford to work full-time all the way through to release, or have to do freelance or get a programmer job to pull it through :)   Eidolons is an innovate hybrid between roguelike and cRPG. Like all things new, there is a space for growth, but also the danger of not being quite understood - or properly executed - in the absense of a well-trodden path.This is my main personal concern. Then there is of course always the project’s somewhat low bus-factor.However, despite its solo-dev origins, the project is structured in a modular way to allow for easy contribution of more people, if it has the the financial means to ensure their welfare.Eidolons project is my life, and I am determined to realize it in some form no matter what. I see see it as a chance start a change in the genre that has, from my perspective, been walking around in circles for decades now.",56.0,1,"1 Campaign
The planet is currently facing the sixth mass species extinction
column2: Gaia the spirit of the earth has chosen you to protect them from their danger cause, the human being.

column1: All characters and scenarios are created from real clay models and photographed, then color enhancement and adjustment is performed, after rigging an animation characters are incorporated, creating a particular aesthetic that gives it its own personality to the game. That is a lot of work.

The game is controlled using gestures, which allow you to command the characters, attack, defend and as the game progresses, dominate the nature forces such as weather manipulation and summon twisters, hurricanes, earthquakes and tsunamis.
The gestures will increase in complexity, even demanding both hands to perform them.

Each character represents an endangered species, which will appear all around the world (sorry flat earthers) as the game progresses and according certain conditions in region where they live, such as time of day, season or weather.

Currently have been modeled hawksbill turtle, vaquita porpoise and Totoaba, some other species included will be orangutans, gorillas, rhinos, tigers, pangolin, polar bear, Iberian lynx, leopard, pink dolphin, spix’s macaw, giraffes and elephants.
The game design is for multi-touch screens
column2: it will be available on Android and iOS.

column1: For promotional reasons a reduced version of the first level was generated to play in the browser, restrictions exporting it to HTML prevents generating all the necessary features for optimal playability therefore on HTML there will be only a reduced demo.
Being able to play in the preferred device orientation, portrait or landscape, some levels will be easier to play portrait and others landscape
Have more than 100 characters with 150 levels or more
Show the current dangers that species face on earth
Each stage represents an ecosystem, marine is the first implemented, savanna, jungle, poles, mountains and desert will be added among others.
Currently 13 gestures and 60 variants are detected, in the future it is planned to reach at least 15 gestures and 100 variants.
So far, all the development has been financed with own resources, but they have already been exhausted, to finish and speed up the game additional funds are needed

It is required to buy a lot of modeling clay (plasticine) and paraffin mixed together to model all the remaining characters, currently they have been made at 1/20 scale but to facilitate the process the next ones will be created at a 1/10 scale
The current models photographs evidenced the need of a better camera and professional lighting to capture more realistic colors and texture details.

Mainly development and tests have been done on the Android system, using several mobile phones and a tablet for testing but porting it to iOS will require acquire Apple hardware consisting of at least one iMac for compilation, an iPhone and an iPad for tests, this hardware will serve to publish this and ours future games on App Store
The funds also will permit Apple Developer Program first year payment
The remainder, if any, will be used in advertising campaign

The game will use freemium model, free download with optional in game purchases and some advertisements, it will not be necessary to make any purchase to play all levels but perseverance and patience.
The player will have an energy limit that will be recharged over time, if you do not want to wait and play unlimitedly use one of our indiegogo perks.

Some characters will appear only at a certain time of day, with a certain weather or in a specific season, in addition to limited time events, a special power will allow the player to travel in time to unlock characters and replay events, there is also the power to change the weather.

Who is ""Steve Schild""? Watch his YouTube Movie.

• Steve Schild is one of the top Mars One Astronaut Candidates in the world. 
    His goal is to get to mars in 2032 with a group of four.
• Mars one will establish a permanent settlement on Mars.
• Steve Schild is also an #scifi #fantasy book author.

• More information you`ll find on his Website.
    www.steveschild.ch

    Who is ""Mario Sieg""?""
• Hi all, my name is Mario, I´m 18 years old and I am the developer behind the game.
• Im a enthusiastic programmer from Germany of games, game engines and mods.
• I really like physics based games like Half-Life 2 and action story games like Metro or Stalker.

• I'm trying to combine story, physics, quests and action into a new 2d game with the focus on quests, which are rich in variety and fun to play. I'm also building some minigames for quests for example like hacking and lockpicking. But some quests are also simple for you: To open a certain door why not shooting some ropes and some heavy old debris from a crane will open it for you.
    I will also implement some easter eggs and quests for you, which are based on real world conspiracy theories, but the community should also have a chance to decide how. We will read doodles and look at your suggestions!
I would really love to develop this game further, so it can be an unique experience for you and for me!

Help to create a new world, a new game universe and be a part of the resistance. 
Tell us your ideas, you can be a part of this game.

• The most expensive part of the game is the ingame character design. 
    For creating all characters, weapons, enemies and more we need the support of a freelancer.
• Our Perks are special perks and you can earn different perks from certificate to complete packages.

• If we don`t reach the goal, we still will complete the game in every case, but we will need much more time then to come to an end (about 3-4 years). With your support we can create the game much faster and easier. (we will go online with the game in October 2020)
• You will have the opportunity to play demos in advance. Your feedback will and will help to improve the game.

If you help us, we can create a big new game world with many charakters, ingame items, special weapons and much more. With your contribution, we can create and design a phantastic game based on a phantastic book.
• We think that building a game today will have a lot of potential, if the ideas and wishes of the community are included. What are you missing within a game? Please just tell us!
• We work hard, every day we are making small step towards the end.

• Look at our pictures and tell us your wishes. What would you like to see? Please just let us know!
    You can use the following email address for sending your wishes:
    steve.schild@bluewin.ch
Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

• Share and like our campaign! 
    You can find us on

And that's all! We are happy to create a new adventure game. Thank you very much for your support and help. 

Questions? You can stay in contact with me on WhatsApp
Steve Schild
+41 79 783 03 06

Proto-G is a boss fights hack and slash PC game that has retro futuristic environment setting. We have carefully designed each boss's uniqueness so that it is compelling and challenging experience to all. What we love developing this game is how we emphasize the console classics of the past with touch of modern UI and gameplay. 

Besides fighting, we also sprinkles interactions with the world such as npc's, our cute police mascots, and character development (move set and equipment). Our vision of the game is a boss fight game which story is enjoyable and easy to follow.

column3: '>We are small group with a goal to share their video games to the world. Headquartered in Jakarta, Indonesia, and consisted of 11 people. We are blessed with passionate and talented people joining this journey, and we just can’t pass this opportunity to build title that will entertain players around the world.

column1:
The theme of this campaign is basically us asking for help to deliver the game until release. Currently, we have 7 full timers and 4 part timers working on the project. Without your help we might need to reduce our team sizes and work longer on the project.

17000 USD is what we believe enough to cover our team salary throughout the development time. We lived far way from the capital, so the living expense is immensely lower than in the capital or developed overseas countries. But never worry about the quality of game we will offer to you, we will deliver even better than what we will show on the demo.

What We Need &
column2:
What You Get

17000 USD is the total amount that will be distributed to salaries, and perks fulfilment. We have covered other upfront cost including software licenses, hardwares, and legal work. Your money will be channelled to monthly operational and again, perks.

column1: If in case we do not reach our full pledge, we might reduces our team number and thus longer period of uncertain release date (pardon of our situation). Despite all of that, we will remain to deliver the game to store and your rightfully rewards.

Most of the perks are created digitally. For example you may claim perks that give you exclusive skins that you can change during the game. We think it's great to look good while you finish the game right ?

Below are not the final representation of what you will get.
Exclusively skinned sword along with dedicated visual and sound effects.

You can also listen to one of our soundtracks here.

For you that loves to collect art book of indie games, we also provide digital &
column2: printed version. Our art book will contain beautiful character concept, visual effects, environment design

column1: We have story and in-game bosses outlined. Each bosses will be completed in 40 days at max (from design, code to polish) to ensure balance between quality and production time. There will be 6 bosses to be developed which exactly the amount required to finish the story. With this we want to assure you that our development time is divided into predicted chunks of time that all of us can approximate.

Worst case might happen is inevitable coworker resignation. But if that might happen, we might need time to find a replacement and request additional time from all backers. The truth is we do not know yet, but at this moment we can see that all talents working passionately and committed to the project. We will ensure that our working culture is nurturing, productive and driven.

We have limited voices to reach people and we need your help to share Proto-G in social media. Besides all of that we also hungry of your comments, critiques and encouragement. Please email us, comment here, reach us, we want to hear your thoughts :)

reach us on

","Proto-G is a boss fights hack and slash PC game that has retro futuristic environment setting. We have carefully designed each boss's uniqueness so that it is compelling and challenging experience to all. What we love developing this game is how we emphasize the console classics of the past with touch of modern UI and gameplay. Besides fighting, we also sprinkles interactions with the world such as npc's, our cute police mascots, and character development (move set and equipment). Our vision of the game is a boss fight game which story is enjoyable and easy to follow.

We are small group with a goal to share their video games to the world. Headquartered in Jakarta, Indonesia, and consisted of 11 people. We are blessed with passionate and talented people joining this journey, and we just can’t pass this opportunity to build title that will entertain players around the world.

The theme of this campaign is basically us asking for help to deliver the game until release. Currently, we have 7 full timers and 4 part timers working on the project. Without your help we might need to reduce our team sizes and work longer on the project.17000 USD is what we believe enough to cover our team salary throughout the development time. We lived far way from the capital, so the living expense is immensely lower than in the capital or developed overseas countries. But never worry about the quality of game we will offer to you, we will deliver even better than what we will show on the demo.What We Need & What You Get17000 USD is the total amount that will be distributed to salaries, and perks fulfilment. We have covered other upfront cost including software licenses, hardwares, and legal work. Your money will be channelled to monthly operational and again, perks.

If in case we do not reach our full pledge, we might reduces our team number and thus longer period of uncertain release date (pardon of our situation). Despite all of that, we will remain to deliver the game to store and your rightfully rewards.

Most of the perks are created digitally. For example you may claim perks that give you exclusive skins that you can change during the game. We think it's great to look good while you finish the game right ?Below are not the final representation of what you will get.
Exclusively skinned sword along with dedicated visual and sound effects.

You can also listen to one of our soundtracks here.For you that loves to collect art book of indie games, we also provide digital & printed version. Our art book will contain beautiful character concept, visual effects, environment design

We have story and in-game bosses outlined. Each bosses will be completed in 40 days at max (from design, code to polish) to ensure balance between quality and production time. There will be 6 bosses to be developed which exactly the amount required to finish the story. With this we want to assure you that our development time is divided into predicted chunks of time that all of us can approximate.

Worst case might happen is inevitable coworker resignation. But if that might happen, we might need time to find a replacement and request additional time from all backers. The truth is we do not know yet, but at this moment we can see that all talents working passionately and committed to the project. We will ensure that our working culture is nurturing, productive and driven.

We have limited voices to reach people and we need your help to share Proto-G in social media. Besides all of that we also hungry of your comments, critiques and encouragement. Please email us, comment here, reach us, we want to hear your thoughts :)reach us on

column2: >Press Kit | Discord | Twitter | Youtube | Instagram | Website
>Hi everyone, we are Surprised Monkey Studio, creators of ""Surviving the Humans"" and we couldn’t be more excited to tell you all about our new project.

column1: Surviving the Humans is a 2D point-and-click adventure-style video game. Where we can be part of a very enriching story of a misunderstood zombie in the 80s. An epic and never seen before story with a fully hand-drawn unique style.
We took the liberty to paraphrase Nelson Mandela, since we belive what he said applies perfectly with the game:

""No one is born hating another person because of the color of his skin, or his background, or his religion. People must learn to hate, and if they can learn to hate, they can be taught to love, for love comes more naturally to the human heart than its opposite. ""

We are sure you remember what a blast you had solving a lot of puzzles in those adventure games we all used and use to love still, such as Monkey Island, Full Throttle, Grim Fandango, and many others. That is why nothing would make us happier if you feel the same way as you did before with our game.
• You have to collect items, use them in the correct places to solve the puzzles and help Cooper in this new adventure.
• Hundreds of interactive objects and a few easter eggs with funny descriptions.

The story was worked on for several months. It is mainly based on the story of Cooper, a zombie who rises from his grave in the 80s in a cemetery knowing absolutely nothing about his past. We accompany and help him throughout an epic story where he learns what it means to be a zombie and how to change human's misconception about it's kind. But beware, you should not let your guard down and try at all times to survive the attacks and intolerance of people.

We belive that a story like this was never told before, that zombies always have to be bad, murderous, and monstrous. That is why we always try to approach things from another perspective, and this game seeks that same thing.

Cooper: is our main character and antihero. He did not choose to become a zombie, but life (or death) had given him a second chance to make an impact.  Now he has to learn his new nature and it's ways. Each action we take will have an impact on the rest of the members of the town, thus setting in motion a compelling story.
His body is in full rot and it is difficult for him to keep his limbs together, but gladly he has a lot of ingenuity and he will use it to achieve his goals.

Vincent: He is a zombie who lives in the cemetery, he is many years old and tries to share his experience with all the zombies. Very fearful of humans, since he has seen his zombie friends fall one after another. He's a mentor, used to getting new zombies under his wing quickly, helping them progress, and teaching them the basics so they can survive as long as possible.

 

George: He is a zombie of British origin, a major general who was in the First World War. He is always at war, especially now with humans as they cause the casualties of his army of zombies. He is in charge of the security of the cemetery, he just wants to exterminate all humans, dominate the town and the world. For him, the cemetery is his fortress, his trench, he does not go out under any circumstances.

 

Spencer: A portly human survivalist, always in camouflage clothing as if prepared for battle at all times. Low-mannered, sullen, and moody. He has a beard and always has a serious expression. He understands that the end of the world is near and he doesn't want to waste time socializing. You want to have control over everything and everyone, controlling and obsessive. Unsure of himself. He hates zombies.

 

Anne: A mainly very sensitive woman, who is afraid of abrupt changes. She is tender and a romantic woman. He likes a lot to walk and be outdoors. She has a bit macabre taste, a fan of horror movies and things a bit sordid. She has curls and a freckled face, she is quite small physically and practically without strength. She works in the local cinema and on weekends in the capfeteria. She has 2 jobs since her boyfriend doesn't work and she has to support him.

 

And many more...

 

The game will have 4 chapters where the situation will change dramatically.

 

 

Exploration: you will explore different locations, each and every one of them with many interactive objects, mysterious and spooky secrets to unveil. Much to explore, much to discover.

Puzzles: you will put your brains to the use to solve the problems and obstacles that appear to Cooper. Only you can help him surpass them.

Inventory: we have an inventory where we will store all the necessary objects to solve the puzzles and help us throughout our adventure. We will also be able to make combinations of certain items, to generate new ones.

Dialogues: we will meet many characters throughout the story, and each of them has a story to tell. We are going to have to talk our way out, or we may need to convince them of certain things to advance in the story.

Dismemberment: We can use Cooper's hand and head to overcome certain obstacles. Listening to conversations or seeing certain things from a small space is no longer a problem when we can leave our head anywhere, or use and interact with certain objects when our hands can perform tasks under our command.

The main objective of ""Surviving the humans"" is to learn what it is to be a zombie. We want it not to be just another graphic adventure, but to innovate new mechanics with a fluid and responsive gameplay. Our former hometown will be our playground, but this time surrounded with a culture full of changes as were the 80s. Not only are we going to try to stay ""alive"", but we are also going to take care of those that matter the most to us, and if necessary, to strike back, not with force, but with our ingenuity, since our nature and rotten body won't stand a chance in combat.

Movement: we can automatically go to the objects location by clicking them, but also move to wherever we want with WASD and the arrows.

Interaction with objects: When pressing on an object, the interactive menu appears that allows us to Grab the object, Examine it, or Talk to it.

Use of objects: items can be used directly by dragging and dropping them from the inventory onto other objects in the scene.

Mini-games: Mini-games are always necessary for an adventure. As in monkey island, it is the battle of the sword, in ""Surviving the humans"" we created the battle of fear. Zombies are slow to catch their victims, so they depend on their skill to throw out a terrifying phrase and petrify their victims with fear. Practice makes perfect, so we must first practice with other zombies in the graveyard.
column2:
/>

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

For us, the art of the game is essential. That is why we decided we wanted the whole game to be drawn by hand and with an unique style. We have a creative process in which we establish what we must do first, we make several sketches, and then the drawing process begins and ends with beautiful results. When we have it ready, we pass it to Unity and apply all kinds of post-processing effects to achieve the final result.

The steps for the creation of art. First a sketch, then it goes to the pc, where the lines, shadows, and color are made. Then it goes to Unity where post-processing, effects and lighting are applied. And after all that, you can see that the results are amazing.

As video games developers, with more than 10 years of acummulated experience as programmers, we took full advantage of Unity engine and built an architecture for the game from scratch. Generating our own cinematics, animations, and mechanics for the game. In the beginning, the game will be released for the platforms: PC, Mac, and Linux. If we manage to raise enough, we will launch on consoles.

0,"

Overview

Unworthy Life is a story driven 3D action RPG with 15 – 20 hours of gameplay. The game is 80% complete and will release on PC and console in approximately 12 months time (September 2020).
Unworthy Life has many levels and environments which include two
column2:
h=AT1RNvyWH3LcR-fpNKFCTSk17pnxXpwRaERU9MYyImSPSgFz45oaFJoKql8FmRB7GwaBijObCKSOmJ8C7BW5p2ck-QxjvB_9cryqyPF238bLQGBJPAs464tW6PKOMHs8xpqV-Q"" rel=""noopener nofollow"" target=""_blank"">open world areas to explore. Players will engage in combat, hacking and physics puzzles as well as upgrading their robot with modular parts and learning or developing new abilities through a skills tree system.

It will be usually be possible to tackle the same situation in several different ways. Our protagonist robot Ul155e5 is a canvas that we hope you can use to play and navigate the story of Unworthy Life in your own preferred way.

We the team behind Unworthy Life have been working on this game for about four years. Our goal as a small team has always been to push the limits of what can be achieved by independent designers on a first game. We also wished to take our skills (mathematics, coding, physics, design) earned from a background in mechanical engineering and apply it to the development of an exciting and modern PC and console game inspired by the 80s science ficition films we grew up with as well as more recent Sci-fi/RPG games we came to love as adults.

We could given enough time probably finish the game and make Unworthy Life into something we really want to play and that we will personally love. However, this has never been about us. We want to make a game that many people will play and love. By backing this campaign you help us get some much needed hardware to smoothly finish the development of this game in 4K resolution, pay for bespoke professional music, allow us to pay talented voice actors and provide the first little bit of money towards the studio support we need to release this game for consoles.

What Are We Offering.

Every backer will receive credit as a BACKER in the credits of the game.

column1: • Every backer of €5 or more will receive the digital OST to the game spanning cinematic orchestral strings, to dark sci-fi to techno, to space age sounds and futuristic ambient.
• In addition to the above every backer of €15 or more will get a full digital copy of the game and will receive a playable demo shortly after the campaign completes.
• Every Backer of €20 or more will receive a digital artbook, full Clcopy of the game, digital OST and credit as a supporter.
• A T-shirt will be added for every backer for €60 or more.
• For €500. You get all of the above and your likeliness can be added to one type of character in the game. All we need is some high quality images of your face from the front and side.
• 1 lucky backer can become a producer of the game for €2,500. If they wish they will be invited to our weekly producers catch up conference call to talk about the game and more.

The Story

Unworthy Life takes place on the fourth planet in the Solar System, one hundred thousand years ago. A technologically advanced society is on the brink of collapse due to the severe and prolonged exploitation of their planet's resources.

Players take on the role of a Ul155e5 a “clockwork” (a robot who works in a factory called “the Mother”).

A clockwork’s salary consists of “cyber-bucks” which functions as their currency and their lifeforce as cyber-bucks act as the charge for a clockwork’s batteries and is the only currency with which to purchase replacement parts. When a clockwork can no longer work or becomes obsolete, they run out of cyber-bucks and die.

The lucky clockworks who have excess cyber-bucks spend them on simulations where they can escape their lives and be spirited away to a lush green planet (Earth).

Besides clockworks (and Gears) the robots which form the most numerous and productive part of the society there are also:

The Angels: Massive demonic beings who act as enforcers keeping control of “The City”.

Mutants: Little is known about mutants few clockworks have ever even seen one. Most don’t even know they exist.

The Pilot: The puppet master of all society.

None of the clockworks are aware of what is produced in “the Mother” and they are too scared to ask.

One fateful day an event occurs in the factory, which challenges the very consciousness of Ul155e5 changing it's life radically. Upon learning what is produced in “the Mother” Ul155e5 loses all hope, gets sick and starts wandering the city aimlessly and confused until Ul155e5 finds an angel threatening a sick clockwork. Ul155e5 intervenes and attacks the angel, Ul155e5 is subsequently arrested and deported to a leviathan prison ship for re-education.

There our protagonist meets other clockworks, and among them, the head of a revolutionary squad which fights against the Mother. After an inspiring conversation, Ul155e5 decides to leave its old life behind and fight back against the established order of the city.

This is the beginning of the adventures of Ul155e5, which will lead it to take part in armed assaults against the key assets of the city, sabotage, recruitment missions and several fights against “The Pilot”.

Throughout this journey, Ul155e5 will experience a number of challenging situations which can be tackled in several different ways, a wide spectrum of emotions and several existential doubts.

Features
• RPG elements including levelling, unique equipment, exploration, decision making, alternative paths.

column2:
Challenges

Assuming a successful IndieGoGo we will deliver this game! The development of Unworthy Life is at an advanced stage. We have waited to launch this campaign until we know that we can complete the game and deliver it promptly.

We have further options to raise any other funds after Indiegogo including investment, finance or further crowdfunding. We have the producers Callum Dougherty and Alan Kay of Cubic7 on board to support us with these goals. Our maximum funding goal is €55,000 whilst the game can be finished for less.

Other Ways You Can Help

Just because you can't contribute cash doesn’t mean you can't help:

column1: • Use the Indiegogo share tools on the campaign page.
• Send a message to your favourite YouTuber requesting they review the game.
• Send an email or contact form message to videogame journalists about Unworthy Life.
• Create a YouTube video about Unworthy Life. Here is a video we love by Knight's Arcade. Videos like this really help!

We look forward to sharing Unworthy Life with you!

We offer Cliker's way of in game transactions to third party developers. Fill free to create new types of games - strategy, RPG or FPS using brand new method.
Fast connection allows you to interact with your phone and transfer
Everyone had that feeling, when you just need something to hold in your
hand. We developed Clicker the way that anyone can easily use it.
If you are left handed or right handed Clicker is still comfortable to
hold. You can put fingers on the top of  the device or hold it upside down. Clicker
smoothly fill your hand, providing satisfaction.
To see when charging is required just check the brightness of logo on the
backside. We made it volumetric so it could help your finger to find a rear fulcrum of the
At the moment 5 colors are available for pre order. Each device weighs around 100 grams.

The greatest chance to convert your pressings to fun, is to send all accumulated Clicks to your phone and use them as currency in the mobile game. We named it ""Clicker the Game"". Click through your friends army!
Order a consignment of 50 devices with unique design  including two new types of Clicker. We have 75
branded devices for demanding customers, with almost any colors combination and
signs. Clicker is a great present for you friends and colleagues, for youtube

Money is not the only way to support our project. Clicking on any of the Facebook, Twitter sharing buttons will help the world to know about Clicker. We appreciate any of your attention. Spasibo!",29.0,0,"1 Campaign
Love programming as well as playing games?

Introducing PixelBots a game where you can program bots and face off against your peers. This is a true test to your programming skills and is the next level of competitive programming.

Pixelbots will be available soon on iOS and Android. Sign up to get notified.
Not comfortable with writing bots? you can play without it as well!
In this game, you can face off against your friends or your bot can do it for you.
Use gestures or program a bot to play this game. You Start off with the orange cell and try to collect all the green cells in shortest path.
• Quickmatch against random opponents or against your friends
Challenge your friend to build a bot and face off against yours
Program the best bot and climb up the ratings

The bots are executed in servers online and not on the mobile device itself. Popular programming languages such as C, C++, C#, Java, Javascript, Perl, Python, Ruby are supported in our early prototype and we have plans to include few other languages as well. The starter kit will help you get started with programming a bot in the language of your choice.
The Project for creating a tournament server for Pixelbots will be made open source soon along with starter kits for creating bots in all the supported languages.
We are considering to open source all the parts of our codebase as well to speed up the development.
PixelBots beta will be made available to our supporters by the third week of February 2015. The game will be made available to the general public by the first week of March 2015.
PixelBots will soon be available on iOS and Android. We'll follow up this game with a series of games on the same concept with more exciting challenges. A desktop version is on the cards too.
No annoying ads even on free versions
We will not hamper user experience by running advertisements.

How you can help

We're currently a team of two developers who are making this happen. In the future, we're planning to build the team and get more designers and developers onboard.
Get one of the perks and be a part of this. Or, help us to get the word out and share this project with your friends.

Connect with us

If you’re interested in knowing more, do follow us on Twitter, Facebook and Google Plus. You can also reach out to us at hello@getpixelbots.com
